Definition The [[Euclidean Inner Product]] is the [[Inner Product]] $\langle \cdot, \cdot \rangle: \mathbb{C}^{n} \to \mathbb{C}$ defined as $$\langle \mathbf{x}, \mathbf{y} \rangle = \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_{i}\bar{y_{i}}$$ for $\mathbf{x}, \mathbf{y} \in \mathbb{C}^{n}$.

Definition Suppose $M$ is a [[Topological Space]]. We say $M$ is a [[Topological Manifold]] with [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$ if $M$ is a [[Hausdorff]] $M$ is a [[Second Countable]] $M$ is [[Locally Euclidean]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$ Examples [[Graphs of Continuous Functions are Topological Manifolds]]

item.title: A Closed Convex Set is the Intersection of all Closed Halfspaces containing it
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$ be [[Closed]] and [[Convex Set|convex]]. Then $$S = \bigcap\limits_{} {H \subset V : S \subset H, H \text{ is a closed halfspace}}$$

item.title: A Compact Set that is not Closed
item.description: [[Counterexample]] Suppose $\mathbb{Z}$ is given the [[Cofinite Topology]]. Suppose $S \subset \mathbb{Z}$. Then $S$ is [[Compact]]. In particular there exists, $S \subset \mathbb{Z}$ that is [[Compact]] but not [[Closed]].

item.title: A Connected Set is Pathwise Connected in a Metric Space
item.description: [[TODO]] - Suppose not. $x, y$ not [[Path-Connected]]. Create [[Set]]s of all points pathwise connected to $x$ and those pathwise connected to $y$.

item.title: A Convex Cone is a Convex Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on $\mathbb{R}$ and let $S \subset V$ be a [[Convex Cone]]. Then $S$ is a [[Convex Set]].

item.title: A Distribution Function is Determined on a Dense Set
item.description: Statement Let $D \subset \mathbb{R}$ be [[Dense]] and let $F_{D}: D \to \mathbb{R}$. Then if we define $$F(x) = \inf_{y \in D; y > x} F_{D}(y)$$ $F$ is a [[Distribution Function]].

item.title: A finite measure is absolutely continuous wrt another iff small sets on the other measure are also small on it
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M})$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $\mu, \nu$ be two [[Measure]]s on this space so that $\nu$ is [[Finite Measure|finite]].

item.title: A Function into the the Product Sigma Algebra is Measureable iff its components are Measureable
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M})$, $(Y_{\alpha}, \mathcal{N}\alpha)$ be [[Measure Space]]s for $\alpha \in A$. Let $Y = \prod\limits{\alpha \in A} Y_\alpha$ and let $\mathcal{N} = \bigotimes\limits_{\alpha \in A} \mathcal{N}\alpha$.

item.title: A Function is Continuous iff it preserves Net Convergence
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. Then $f$ is a [[Continuous Function]] [[If and Only If]] for all [[Net]]s ${x_{\alpha}}{\alpha \in A} \subset X$, if $\lim\limits{\alpha \in A}x_{\alpha} = x$ then $\lim\limits_{\alpha \in A}f(x_{\alpha}) = f(x)$.

item.title: A Function is Continuous iff it takes Closed Sets back to Closed Sets
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \tau), (Y, \rho)$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. Then $f$ is a [[Continuous Function]] [[If and Only If]] for all [[Closed]] $K \subset Y$, $f^{-1}(Y)$ is [[Closed]] in $X$.

item.title: A Function is Measureable iff Preimages of Generating Sets are in the Source Sigma-Algebra
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M})$, $(Y, \mathcal{N})$ be [[Measure Space]]s and let $f: X \to Y$. Suppose $\mathcal{N} = \sigma(\mathcal{E})$ for some $\mathcal{E} \subset \mathcal{P}(Y)$ (i.

item.title: A Hilbert Space has a Countable Orthonormal Basis iff it is Separable
item.description: [[TODO]] - See StackExchange [[Hilbert Space]] [[Separable Space]] [[Countable]] [[Dense]] [[Orthonormal Basis]]

item.title: A Limit Point that is not a Sequence Limit
item.description: Example Consider $\mathbb{R}$ equipped with the [[Cocountable Topology]]. Consider $S = \mathbb{R} \setminus {0}$. Then $0$ is a [[Limit Point]] of $S$.

item.title: A Linear Equation System is Homogenous iff its constants are 0
item.description: Statement Let $V, W$ be [[Vector Space]]s over the same [[Field]] $F$. Consider the [[Linear Equation System]] $$T_{\alpha}(\mathbf{x}) = \mathbf{b}{\alpha} \text{ }\forall \alpha \in A$$ Then this system is a [[Homogenous Linear System]] [[If and Only If]] $\mathbf{b}{\alpha} = \mathbf{0} \in W$ $\forall \alpha \in A$.

item.title: A Linearly Dependent Set contains a vector in the Span of the others
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$ and let $S \subset V$ be [[Linearly Dependent]]. Then there exists $\mathbf{v} \in S$ so that $\mathbf{v} \in \text{span} (S \setminus {v})$.

item.title: A Measureable Function is less than or equal to another iff all its integrals are less than or equal to the others
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $f, g \in L^{1}(\mathcal{M})$. Then $f \leq g$ [[Almost Everywhere]] [[If and Only If]] $$\int\limits_{A} f d \mu \leq \int\limits_{A} g d \mu$$ $\forall A \in \mathcal{M}$.

item.title: A Metric Space where the Closure of an Open Ball is not the Closed Ball
item.description: Counterexample Consider $\mathbb{Z}$ equipped with the [[Discrete Metric]]. Then $\text{cl}B_{1}(0) \subsetneq \overline{B_{1}(0)}$. Proof By definition of [[Open Ball]] and [[Closed Ball]] $$B_{1}(0) = {x \in \mathbb{Z} : d(0,x) < 1} = {0}$$ and $$\overline{B_{1}(0)} = {x \in \mathbb{Z} : d(0,x) \leq 1} = \mathbb{Z}.

item.title: A Minimum in a Total Ordering is Unique
item.description: Statement Suppose $(T, \leq)$ is a [[Total Ordering]]. Let $A \subset T$. Then if $x \in A$ is a [[Minimum|minimal element]] of $A$, $x$ is the only [[Minimum]] of $A$.

item.title: A Nonempty Set is Compact in the Order Topology iff it is Tightly Bounded and Complete
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] endowed with the [[Order Topology]]. Then [[Nonempty]] $K \subset X$ is [[Compact]] [[If and Only If]] $K$ is a [[Tightly Bounded Set]] and $(K, \leq {\big|}_{K^{2}})$ is a [[Complete Ordering]].

item.title: A Normed Vector Space is a Topological Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $X$ is a [[Topological Vector Space]]. Proof [[TODO]] put results about algebraic operations in the page below, and reference them from pages like this one.

item.title: A Normed Vector Space is Complete iff all Absolutely Convergent Series Converge
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $X$ is a [[Complete Metric Space]] [[If and Only If]] for all $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$ such that $\sum\limits_{n=1 }^{\infty} ||x_{n}||$ [[Series Convergence|converges]], $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$ [[Series Convergence|converges]] in $X$.

item.title: A point in a First Countable Space is a Limit Point iff it is a Sequential Limit
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[First Countable Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $\bar{S} = {x : \exists (x_n) \subset S \text{ s.

item.title: A point is a Limit Point iff it is a Net Limit
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $x \in X$ is a [[Limit Point]] of $S$ [[If and Only If]] there exists a [[Net]] ${x_{\alpha}}{\alpha \in A} \subset S$ such that $x{\alpha}\to x$.

item.title: A Real Vector Space over the Rational Field is Infinite-Dimensional
item.description: Statement [[TODO]] - $\mathbb{R}^{n}$ over $\mathbb{Q}$ is an [[Infinite-Dimensional Vector Space]] (this uses [[Countable|countability]] of [[Linear Combination]]s with [[Rational Numbers]] as coefficients).

item.title: A Sequence Converges on the Extended Reals iff the number of Complete Upcrossings is Finite
item.description: Statement Let $(x_{n}){n=0}^{\infty} \subset \mathbb{R}$. Then $(x{n})$ [[Sequence Convergence|converges]] in $\bar{\mathbb{R}}$ [[If and Only If]] $U_{\infty}^{*}[a, b] < \infty$ $\forall a, b \in \mathbb{Q}$.

item.title: A Sequence is a Net
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let ${x_n}{n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$ be a [[Sequence]]. Then ${x_n}{n=1}^{\infty}$ is a [[Net]]. Proof This follows by simply noting that $\mathbb{N}$ is [[Archimedean]] with its natural [[Well-Ordering]].

item.title: A Sequence of Gaussian Random Variables that converge in L1 converge to a Gaussian
item.description: [[TODO]] see - [[Stat 502 - Probability II]] final exam problem 1.

item.title: A Sequence of L1 Random Variables is L1 convergent iff they converge in probability and are Uniformly Integrable
item.description: [[TODO]] - see Thm 6.6.1 in [[Resnick - A Probability Path]] pg 191 [[L1 Integrable Functions]] [[Random Variable]] [[Sequence Convergence]] [[Uniform Integrability]]

item.title: A Set is a Basis iff it is a Maximal Linearly Independent Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] Then $S \subset V$ is a [[Vector Space Basis]] for $V$ [[If and Only If]] it is a [[Maximal]] [[Linearly Independent]] subset of $V$.

item.title: A Set is a Basis iff it is a Minimal Spanning Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$. Then $S \subset V$ is a [[Vector Space Basis]] [[If and Only If]] it is a [[Minimal]] [[Spanning Set|spanning]] subset of $V$.

item.title: A Set is Affine iff it contains all of its Affine Combinations
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. $S$ is a [[Affine Set]] [[If and Only If]] $\forall n \in \mathbb{N}$, $x_{1}, \dots, x_{n} \in S$, all [[Affine Combination]]s (of $x_{1}, \cdots, x_{n}$) $\lambda_{1} x_{1} + \cdots + \lambda_{n} x_{n} \in S$.

item.title: A set is Closed iff it contains all its Limit Points
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then $K \subset X$ is [[Closed]] [[If and Only If]] $\bar{K} \subset K$.

item.title: A Set is Closed iff it contains all Net Limits
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then $K \subset X$ is [[Closed]] [[If and Only If]] for all [[Net]]s ${x_{\alpha}}{\alpha \in A} \subset K$ s.

item.title: A Set is Closed iff it is its own Closure
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $K \subset X$ is [[Closed]] [[If and Only If]] $\text{cl} K = K$.

item.title: A Set is Closed in a First Countable Space iff it contains all its Sequential Limits
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[First Countable Space]]. Then $K \subset X$ is [[Closed]] [[If and Only If]] $$K \supset {x : \exists (x_n) \subset K \text{ s.

item.title: A Set is Closed in a Metric Space iff it contains all its Sequential Limits
item.description: Statement Suppose $(M, d)$ is a [[Metric Space]] and $S \subset M$. Then $S$ is [[Closed]] [[If and Only If]] $S$ contains all of it’s [[Sequence Convergence|sequential limits]].

item.title: A Set is Convex iff it contains all of its Convex Combinations
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. $S$ is a [[Convex Set]] [[If and Only If]] $\forall n \in \mathbb{N}$, $x_{1}, \dots, x_{n} \in S$, all [[Convex Combination]]s (of $x_{1}, \cdots, x_{n}$) $\lambda_{1} x_{1} + \cdots + \lambda_{n} x_{n} \in S$.

item.title: A Set is Open in the Metric Topology iff it contains a Ball around each Point
item.description: Statement Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] endowed with the [[Metric Topology]]. $U \subset M$ is [[Open]] [[If and Only If]] $\forall x \in U$, there exists $\epsilon > 0$ s.

item.title: A sigma-finite measure is absolutely continuous wrt another sigma-finite measure iff their Radon-Nikodym Derivative exists
item.description: [[TODO]] [[Absolute Continuity]] [[Integration defines an Absolutely Continuous Measure]] [[Radon-Nikodym Derivative]] [[Lebesgue Decomposition Theorem]]

item.title: A Simple Function Induces a Finite Sigma Algebra
item.description: Statement Let $(Y, \mathcal{N})$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Suppose $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Simple Function]].

item.title: A Space with Connected Components that are not Open
item.description: Example Consider $\mathbb{Q}$ equipped with the [[Subspace Topology]] of [[Euclidean Space]]. Then no [[Connected Component]] of $\mathbb{Q}$ is [[Open]]. Proof Singletons are always [[Connected]].

item.title: A Submartingale has uniformly Bounded First Moment iff it has uniformly Bounded Positive Moment
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] . Let $(X_{n}){n \geq 1}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Process|discrete-time]] [[Submartingale]] wrt [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{F}{n} \subset \mathcal{B}){n \in \mathbb{N}}$ .

item.title: A Subset of a Vector Space is a Subspace iff it contains all its Linear Combinations
item.description: Statement $W$ is a [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$ [[If and Only If]] $\forall n \in \mathbb{Z}{\geq 0}$, $x{1}, \dots x_{n} \in W$, $c_{1}, \dots, c_{n} \in F$, $c_{1} x_{1} + \cdots + c_{n} x_{n} \in W$.

item.title: A Subset of a Vector Space is a Subspace iff it is closed under scaling and addition
item.description: Statement $W$ is a [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$ [[If and Only If]] $c u + v \in W$ for all $c \in F$ and $u, v \in W$.

item.title: A Topological Basis can be thinned out by a smaller one
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Basis]] and let $\mathcal{M}$ be a [[Topological Basis]]. Then if $\mathcal{B}$ is another [[Topological Basis]] for $X$, there exists $\mathcal{B}’ \subset \mathcal{B}$ so that

item.title: A Union of all Neighborhood Bases is a Topological Basis
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]] and for each $x \in X$, $\mathcal{B}{x}$ is a [[Neighborhood Basis]] for $x$.

item.title: A Vector Space is Finite-Dimensional iff it has a Finite Spanning Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then there is some [[Finite Set|finite]] $S \subset V$ for which $\text{span} S = V$ [[If and Only If]] $V$ is a [[Finite-Dimensional Vector Space]].

item.title: A Vector Space is Infinite-Dimensional iff its Linearly Independent Set Size is Unbounded
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $V$ is an [[Infinite-Dimensional Vector Space]] [[If and Only If]] for any $n \in \mathbb{N}$, there exists some $S \subset V$ so that $|S| > n$.

item.title: A Vector Space is Infinite-Dimensional iff there exists an Infinite Linearly Independent Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $V$ is an [[Infinite-Dimensional Vector Space]] [[If and Only If]] there exists [[Linearly Independent]] $R \subset V$ so that $|R| = \infty$.

item.title: Abelian Group
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is a [[Group]]. Then if $ab = ba$ for all $a, b \in G$, we say that $G$ is an [[Abelian Group]].

item.title: About Me
item.description: I grew up in Dayton, Ohio. We’re big enough to be on a map, but small enough that you probably don’t know where it is.

item.description:

u$ be two [[Measure]]s on this space. We say that $
u « \mu$ ($
u$ is [[Absolute Continuity|absolute continuous]] wrt $\mu$) if $ orall A \in \mathcal{M}$ s.

item.title: Absolute Convergence
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]] and let $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$. We say the [[Series]] $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} x_{n}$ [[Absolute Convergence|converges absolutely]] if $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} ||x_{n}||$ [[Series Convergence|converges]] in $\mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Adapted Process
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $X: \Omega \to S^{T}$ be a [[Stochastic Process]] with [[State Space]] $(S, \Sigma)$, and let $\mathcal{F} := (\mathcal{B}{t}){t \in T}$ be a [[Filtration]] on $\Omega$.

item.title: Adjacency Matrix
item.description: Definition 1 Suppose $G = (V,E)$ is a [[Directed Graph]]. Then the [[Adjacency Matrix]] of $G$, denoted $\text{Adj}(G) \in {0, 1}^{|V| \times |V|}$ is the [[Matrix]] with entries

item.title: Affine Combination
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $x_{1}, \dots, x_{n} \in V$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Suppose $\lambda_{1}, \dots, \lambda_{n} \in \mathbb{R}$ and $\sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} \lambda_{i} = 1$.

item.title: Affine Dimension
item.description: Definition 1 Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $S \subset V$ be an [[Affine Set]]. Then the [[Affine Dimension]] of $S$ is the [[Dimension of a Vector Space|dimension]] of the [[Subspace associated with an Affine Set|subspace associated with]] $S$.

item.title: Affine Hull
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. Let $\mathcal{T} = {T \subset V : S \subset T, T \text{ is affine}}$.

item.title: Affine Set
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. $S$ is an [[Affine Set]] if for all $\lambda \in \mathbb{R}$ and all $u, v \in S$ $$\lambda u + (1 - \lambda) v \in S$$

item.title: Affine Sets are Convex
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$ be an [[Affine Set]]. Then $S$ is a [[Convex Set]].

item.title: All Finite Bases for a Vector Space are the same Size
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Finite-Dimensional Vector Space]] and let distinct $\mathbf{a}{1}, \dots, \mathbf{a}{n} \in V$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$ be a [[Vector Space Basis]] for $V$.

item.title: All points in a Set are Limit Points
item.description: Statement Let $X, \tau$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $$\bar{S} \supset S$$ Proof Suppose $x \in S$.

item.title: All Simple Functions can be Written in Standard Form
item.description: Statement Let $\phi: X \to \mathbb{C}^{n}$ be a [[Simple Function]]. Let $F = \phi(X)$ (which is a [[Finite Set]]). Let ${A_{i}} = {\phi^{-1}({a_{i}}) \subset X : a_{i} \in F}$.

item.title: Almost Everywhere Equivalence Relation
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ and $(Y, \mathcal{N}, \nu)$ be [[Measure Space]]s. Define the relation $\sim$ on $\mathcal{L}^{0}$ as $f \sim g$ for $f,g \in \mathcal{L}^{0}$ if ${x \in X : f(x) \neq g(x)}$ is a $\mu$-[[Null Set]].

item.title: Almost Everywhere Pointwise Convergence
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ is a [[Measure Space]] and $(Y, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $(f_{n})$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Function]]s from $X$ to $Y$ and suppose $f: X \to Y$.

item.title: Almost Sure Convergence
item.description: Definition Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $(Y, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $(X_{n} : \Omega \to Y)$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Element]]s and $X: \Omega \to Y$ is a [[Random Element]].

item.title: Almost Sure Convergence does not imply Lp Convergence
item.description: Statement Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $(X_{n})$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$. Suppose $X_{n} \to X$ [[Almost Sure Convergence|almost surely]].

item.title: Alternate Option for CE
item.description: Consider the following setup: [[Probability Space]] $(\Omega, \mathcal{F}, \mathbb{P})$ [[Random Variable]] $U: \Omega \to {0, 1}^{k}$ with [[Uniform Distribution]]. Measureable Functions Encoder $f: {0, 1}^{k} \to {0,1}^{n}$ Noise Function $q: {0,1}^{n} \times \Omega \to \mathbb{R}^{n}$ Likelihood Function $l: \mathbb{R}^{n} \to [0,1]^{k}$.

item.title: Anaconda
item.description: [[Anaconda]] is a [[Virtual Environment]] management system for [[Python]]. Some useful commands Useful Commands ![[Revert to an older version of a Conda environment]]

item.title: Andrs E. Caicedo
item.description: Math StackExchange User

item.title: Arc Head
item.description: Definition Let $G = (V, E)$ be a [[Directed Graph]] and let $(u, v) \in E$ be an [[Graph Arc|arc]]. Then the [[Arc Head]] of $(u, v)$ is $h((u, v)) = u$.

item.title: Arc Tail
item.description: Definition Let $G = (V, E)$ be a [[Directed Graph]] and let $(u, v) \in E$ be an [[Graph Arc|arc]]. Then the [[Arc Head]] of $(u, v)$ is $t((u, v)) = v$.

item.title: Arity
item.description: Definition The [[Arity]] of a [[Function]] is the number of arguments it takes. The [[Arity]] of a [[Relation]] is the number of items it relates.

item.title: Assignment
item.description: Definition Let $V = {v_{0}, v_{1}, \dots}$ be the [[Set]] of [[Variable Symbol]]s. Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and $\mathcal{M}$ an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]].

item.title: Atomic Language Formula
item.description: Definition An [[Atomic Language Formula|atomic]] $\mathcal{L}$-formula is a string $\phi$ of form either $t_{1} = t_{2}$ for $t_{1}, t_{2} \in \mathcal{T}$.

item.title: Augmenting Network Flow Paths for Bipartite Matching Flow Formulation are Matching Augmenting Paths
Augmenting Path Theorem of Matchings
item.description: Statement Suppose $G = (V, E)$ is an [[Undirected Graph]] and $M$ is a [[Matching]] on $G$. Then $M$ is a [[Maximum Matching]] on $G$ [[If and Only If]] there is no $M$-[[Matching Augmenting Path|augmenting path]].

item.title: Axiom
item.description: Definition This is more of a conceptual [[Object]] rather than a rigorously defined [[Object]]. Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. We call an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Sentence]] $\phi$ an [[Axiom]] when it is part of a [[Theory]] for some [[Elementary Class]].

item.title: Axiom of Extensionality
item.description: Axiom $$\forall A \forall B [ \forall x(x \in A \Leftrightarrow x \in B) \Rightarrow A = B]$$ This [[Sentence]] is stating that for all [[Set]]s $A, B$, if they share the same elements, then they are the same [[Set]]s.

item.title: Axiom of Pairing
item.description: [[Axiom]] $$\forall u \forall v \exists B \forall x [x \in B \Leftrightarrow (x = u \vee x = v)]$$ This axiom allows us to create sets containing any two elements we already know to exist.

item.title: Axiom of Power Set
item.description: [[Axiom]] $$\forall a \exists B \forall x (x \in B \Leftrightarrow x \subset a)$$ This [[Axiom]] is stating the existence of the [[Power Set]] of any [[Set]] that already exists.

item.title: Axiom of Union
item.description: [[Axiom]] Formally, $$\forall A \exists B \forall c (c \in B \Leftrightarrow \exists D (c \in D \wedge D \in A)).

item.title: Axiom Schema
item.description: Definition An [[Axiom Schema]] is a [[Set]] of [[Axiom]]s

item.title: Axiom Schema of Specification
item.description: [[Axiom Schema]] Let $k \in \mathbb{N}$ and let $\phi$ be a [[Formula]] with [[Free Variable]]s among $x, t_{1}, \dots, t_{k}, c$.

item.title: Baby Skorohod Theorem
item.description: Statement Let ${X_{n} : n \geq 0}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Variable]]s (not necessarily defined on the same [[Probability Space]]) so that $X_{n} \Rightarrow X_{0}$.

item.title: Banach Space
item.description: Definition A [[Banach Space]] is a [[Normed Vector Space]] that is a [[Complete Metric Space]].

item.title: Banach Spaces are Separable if they contain a Countable Total Subset
item.description: Statement A [[Banach Space]] $X$ is a [[Separable Space]] if there exists [[Countable]] [[Total Subset]] $A \subset X$. Proof [[TODO]]

item.title: Basic Properties of Bi-Ordered Groups
item.description: Statement Here we list some basic properties of [[Bi-Ordered Group]]. Let $(G, \leq)$ be a [[Bi-Ordered Group]]. $\forall g,h,g’,h’ \in G$, $g \leq g’ \wedge h \leq g’ \Rightarrow gh \leq g’h'$ [[TODO]] Proof $gh \leq g’h \leq g’h’$ $\checkmark$

item.title: Bayes Classifier
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. The [[Bayes Classifier]] is a [[Classifier]] $f: \mathcal{D} \to [n]$ so that for $x \in \mathcal{D}$

item.title: Bayes Classifier is Risk Minimizer
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y, n$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Then the [[Bayes Classifier]] minimizes [[Risk]]. It is the unique minimizer up to modifications on $\mathbb{P}$-[[Null Set]]s of $\mathcal{D}$ and subsets of $E = {x \in \mathcal{D} : \mathbb{P}(Y=y|X) = \frac{1}{n} \forall y \in [n]}$.

item.title: Bayes Soft Classifier is Cross-Entropy Minimizer
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y, n$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Then the [[Likelihood Soft Classifier]] minimizes [[Cross-Entropy]]. It is the unique minimizer up to modifications on $\mathbb{P}$-[[Null Set]]s of $\mathcal{D}$.

item.title: Bayes Theorem
item.description: Statement 1 Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $A, B \in \mathcal{B}$ so that $\mathbb{P}(B), \mathbb{P}(A) > 0$.

item.title: Bi-Ordered Group
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be a [[Group]] and let $\leq$ be a [[Total Ordering]] on $G$. We say $G$ is a [[Bi-Ordered Group]] if it is a [[Left Ordered Group]] and a [[Right Ordered Group]].

item.title: Bijection
item.description: Definition A [[Function]] that is both an [[Injection]] and a [[Surjection]]. Properties Every [[Bijection]] $f: X \to Y$ has a [[Function Inverse]].

item.title: Binary Cross-Entropy
item.description: Definition This is just [[Cross-Entropy]] when $|\mathcal{L}| = 2$.

item.title: Binary Entropy
item.description: [[Shannon Entropy]] of a [[Bernoulli Distribution]].

item.title: Bipartite Graph
item.description: Definition A [[Bipartite Graph]] is an [[Undirected Graph]] $(V, E)$ so that there exists a [[Partition]] ${A, B}$ of $V$ s.

item.title: Bit Error Rate
item.description: [[Risk]] on each bit of the input sequence.

item.title: Boolean Function
item.description: Definition A [[Boolean Function]] is a [[Function]] $f: {0, 1}^{n} \to {0, 1}$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Other Outlinks [[Natural Numbers]] [[Hypercube]]

item.title: Borel-Cantelli Lemma
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \in \mathcal{M}$. If $$\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} \mu(A_{n}) < \infty$$ then $$\mu(\limsup\limits_{n \to \infty} A_{n}) = 0$$

item.title: Bound Variable
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $\phi$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Formula|formula]]. Suppose [[Variable Symbol]] $v$ occurs in $\phi$. We say $v$ is a [[Bound Variable]] in $\phi$ if it occurs in a $\exists v$ or $\forall v$ [[Quantifier]].

item.title: Boundary
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then the [[Boundary]] of $S$, denoted $\text{bd}S$, is the [[Set]] $$\text{bd}S := \text{cl} S \setminus \text{int} S.

item.title: Bounded Closed Intervals are Compact in the Order Topology iff the Order is Complete
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] endowed with the [[Order Topology]]. Then for $a,b \in X$, $[a,b]$ is [[Compact]] [[If and Only If]] $(X, \leq)$ is a [[Complete Ordering]].

item.title: Bounded Continuous Function Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $(Y, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $$C_{b}(X, Y) := {f: X \to Y : \sup\limits_{x \in X} ||f(x)|| < \infty, f \text{ is continuous}}$$ is a [[Normed Vector Space]] with the [[Supremum Norm]] $||\cdot||_{\infty}$.

item.title: Bounded Function Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $(Y, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $$B(X, Y) := {f: X \to Y : \sup\limits_{x \in X} ||f(x)|| < \infty}$$ is a [[Normed Vector Space]] with the [[Supremum Norm]] $||\cdot||_{\infty}$.

item.title: Bounded Monotone Convergence Theorem
item.description: A special case of [[Every Sequence on the Reals has a Monotone Subsequence]]

item.title: Bounded Set
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] and let $A \subset M$. We say $A$ is a [[Bounded Set]] if $\sup\limits_{x,y \in A} d(x,y) < \infty$.

item.title: Bounded Strategy on Martingale is a Martingale
item.description: Statement a Proof First note that for $n \geq 1$ because $H_{n}$ is [[Bounded Function|bounded]], say by $M \in \mathbb{R}{\geq 0}$ $$\begin{align*} \mathbb{E}|(H \cdot X){n}| &= \mathbb{E}\left|\sum\limits_{m=1}^{n}H_{m}(X_{m} - X_{m-1})\right|\ &\leq M \sum\limits_{m=1}^{n} \mathbb{E}|X_{m} - X_{m-1}| & \text{(Triangle Inequality)}\ &\leq M \sum\limits_{m=1}^{n} \mathbb{E}|X_{m}| + \mathbb{E}| X_{m-1}| & \text{(Triangle Inequality)}\\ &< \infty \end{align*}$$ since $X_{m} \in L^{1}(\mathcal{B})$ $\forall m \geq 0$.

item.title: c0 is Banach
item.description: Statement $c_{0}$ is a [[Banach Space]]. Proof [[TODO]] Other Outlinks [[c0 Space]]

item.title: c0 Space
item.description: Definition We define $c_0$ as $$c_{0} := {({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset \mathbb{R} : \lim\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} x_{n} \to 0}$$ equipped with the norm $||x||{\infty} := \sup\limits{n \in \mathbb{N}} |x_{n}|$ for $x \in l_{\infty}$.

item.title: Cardinal Arithmetic
item.description: [[TODO]] Exponentiation If $\kappa$ is an [[Infinite Set|infinite]] [[Set Cardinality|cardinal]], then $\kappa^{2} = \kappa$. Remarks https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/2901201/a-cardinality-number-to-the-square-is-itself https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/180671/cardinality-of-cartesian-square/180691#180691 This is equivalent to [[Axiom of Choice]]

item.title: Cartesian Product
item.description: Definition 1 Let $A, B$ be [[Set]]s. The [[Cartesian Product]], denoted $A \times B$ is defined as the [[Set]] $$A \times B := {(a, b) : a \in A, b \in B}$$

item.title: Cauchy Sequence
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. We say $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset M$ is a [[Cauchy Sequence]] if $\forall \epsilon> 0$ ther exists $N \in \mathbb{N}$ so that for all $n,m \geq N$, $d(x_{n}, x_{m}) < \epsilon$.

item.title: Centered Random Variable
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] on $\Omega$. We say that $X$ is a [[Centered Random Variable]] if $\mathbb{E}(X) = 0$.

item.title: Characteristic Function
item.description: Definition Suppose $X$ is a [[Random Variable]] on [[Probability Space]] $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$. The [[Characteristic Function]] of $X$ is a function $\phi_{X}: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{C}$ defined as

item.title: Characteristic Function of a Gaussian Random Variable
item.description: Statement Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $X \sim \mathcal{N}(\mu, \sigma^{2})$. Then $$\phi_{X}(t) = \exp (i t \mu - \frac{\sigma^{2} t^{2}}{2})$$

item.title: Characteristic Function of Standard Gaussian Random Variable
item.description: Statement Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $X$ is a [[Standard Gaussian Random Variable]]. Then $$\phi_{X}(t) = \exp (\frac{t^{2}}{2})$$

item.description: See Wikipedia - Standard Borel Spaces and Kuratowski’s Theorems [[Standard Borel Space]] [[Polish Space]]

item.title: Class
item.description: Defintion A [[Class]] is an association of [[Object]]s (which are not [[Class]]es) that share some property.

item.title: Classification Problem
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $(\mathcal{D}, \Sigma_{1})$ and $([n], \mathcal{P}([n]))$ be [[Measure Space]]s (for $n \in \mathbb{N}$).

item.title: Classifier
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Then a [[Classifier]] is a [[Function]] $f: \mathcal{D} \to [n]$.

item.title: Closed
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then $K \subset X$ is [[Closed]] if $K^{C}$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Closed Ball
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. The [[Closed Ball]] about $x \in M$ of radius $\epsilon > 0$ is $$\overline{B_{\epsilon}(x)} := {x’ \in X : d(x, x’) \leq \epsilon}$$

item.title: Closed Ball is Closed
item.description: Statement Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. Let $x \in M$ and $\epsilon > 0$. Then $\overline{B_{\epsilon}(x)}$ is [[Closed]].

item.title: Closed Halfspace
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$. A [[Closed Halfspace]] is a [[Set]] of the form $$H = {x : \langle x, a \rangle \geq b}$$ for any $a \in V$ and $b \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Closed Interval
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. An [[Closed Interval]] is $[a,b]$ for $a \leq b \in T$ is the [[Set]] $$[a,b] := {x \in T : a \leq x \leq b}$$

item.title: Closed Intervals are Closed
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] equipped with the [[Order Topology]]. Then the following [[Set]]s are [[Closed]]: $[a,b]$ for all $a, b \in X$ so $a \leq b$.

item.title: Closed Line Segment
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $x_{1}, x_{2} \in V$. The [[Closed Line Segment]] $L \subset V$ between $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ the [[Set]] $$L = {\lambda x_{1} + (1 - \lambda) x_{2} : \lambda \in [0,1]}$$

item.title: Closed Map
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s. Then $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Closed Map]] if for all $K \subset X$ [[Closed]] in $X$, $f(K) \subset Y$ is [[Closed]] in $Y$.

item.title: Closed Ray
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. A [[Closed Ray]] is a [[Set]] $R \subset T$ of the form $R := {x \in T : x \leq a}$ or $R := {x \in T : x \geq a}$ for some $a \in T$.

item.title: Closed Subset of a Compact Set is Compact
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $S \subset X$ is [[Compact]] and $K \subset S$ is [[Closed]]. Then $K$ is [[Compact]].

item.title: Closed Subset of a Complete Space is Complete
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(X, d)$ be a [[Complete Metric Space]]. Suppose $C \subset X$ is [[Closed]]. Then $(C, d {\big|}_{C \times C})$ is a [[Complete Metric Space]].

item.title: Closed Subspaces of a Banach Space are Banach
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Banach Space]]. Suppose $C \subset X$ is a [[Closed]] [[Vector Subspace]]. Then $(C, ||\cdot|| {\big|}_{C})$ is a [[Banach Space]].

item.title: Closed Unit Ball
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. The [[Closed Unit Ball]] is the [[Closed Ball]] of radius $1$ about $0 \in X$.

item.title: Closure
item.description: Definition Let $X, \tau$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then the [[Closure]] of $S$, denoted $\text{cl}S$ is

item.title: Closure is Monotonic
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $A \subset B \subset X$. Then $\text{cl} A \subset \text{cl} B$. Proof [[Limit Points of a subset are Limit Points of the original Set]] so [[Limit Point]]s of $A$ are [[Limit Point]]s of $B$.

item.title: Closure of a Set in a First Countable Space is all its Sequential Limits
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[First Countable Space]]. Suppose $S \subset X$ Then $$\text{cl} S = {x : \exists (x_n) \subset S \text{ s.

item.title: Closure of a Set in a Metric Space is all its Sequential Limits
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, d)$ is a [[Metric Space]]. Suppose $S \subset X$ Then $$\text{cl} S = {x : \exists (x_n) \subset S \text{ s.

item.title: Closure of a Set is all its Limit Points
item.description: Statement Let $X, \tau$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $$\text{cl} S = \bar{S}$$ Proof First we show $\bar{S}$ is [[Closed]].

item.title: Closure of a Set is all its Net Limits
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $$\text{cl}S = {x \in X : x_{\alpha} \to x \text{ for some net } (x_{\alpha})_{\alpha \in A} \subset X}$$

item.title: Closure of Open Ball is a subset of Closed Ball
item.description: Definition Let $(X, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. Let $x \in M$ and let $\epsilon > 0$. Then $\text{cl}B_{\epsilon}(x) \subset \overline{B_{\epsilon}(x)}$.

item.title: Closure of Open Unit Ball is Closed Unit Ball
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $\text{cl}B(X) = \overline{B(X)}$. Proof [[Closure of Open Ball is a subset of Closed Ball]] so $\text{cl}B(X) \subset \overline{B(X)}$.

item.title: Cocountable Topology
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Then the [[Open]] sets $$\tau := {U \subset X : U^{C} \text{ is countable}} \cup {X, \emptyset}$$ make $X$ a [[Topological Space]].

item.title: Cofinal Subset
item.description: Definition Let $A$ be a [[Partial Ordering]] and let $B \subset A$. We say $B$ is a [[Cofinal Subset]] of $A$ if $\forall a \in A$, $\exists b \in B$ s.

item.title: Cofinite Topology
item.description: Definition Let $S$ be a [[Set]]. The [[Cofinite Topology]] on $S$ is the [[Topological Space]] $$\tau := {U \subset S : |U^{C}| < \infty } \cup {\emptyset}$$

item.title: Coincidence Lemma
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $\mathcal{M}$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]]. Then the following are true Suppose $t$ is a an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Term]] and $\sigma, \tau : V \to M$ are [[Assignment]]s agreeing on all [[Variable Symbol]]s occuring in $t$.

item.title: Compact
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. We say $K \subset X$ is [[Compact]] if every [[Open Cover]] of $K$ can be reduced to a [[Finite Set|finite]] [[Open Subcover]].

item.title: Compact Function Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $K \subset X$ be [[Compact]]. Let $(Y, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]].

item.title: Compact Sets are Bounded
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(Y, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] with the [[Order Topology]]. Let $K \subset Y$ be [[Compact]]. Then $K$ is a [[Bounded Set]].

item.title: Compact Sets are Separable from Points in a Hausdorff Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Hausdorff]] [[Topological Space]]. Then if $K \subset X$ is [[Compact]] and $y \not\in X$, then there exists $U, V \subset X$ [[Open]] so that

item.title: Compact Sets in Hausdorff Spaces are Closed
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Hausdorff]] [[Topological Space]]. Then if $K \subset X$ is [[Compact]], $K$ is [[Closed]]. Proof Let $x \in K^{C}$.

item.title: Compact Sets in the Order Topology contain their Extrema
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] and let $K \subset X$ be [[Compact]]. Then $\sup\limits K$ and $\inf\limits K$ both exist.

item.title: Compact Spaces are Complete
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(K, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] equipped with the [[Order Topology]] that is [[Compact]]. Then it is a [[Complete Ordering]].

item.title: Compactness is a Topological Invariant
item.description: Statement Suppose $X, Y$ are [[Topological Space]]s and $X \cong Y$. Then $X$ is [[Compact|compact]] [[If and Only If]] $Y$ is.

item.title: Comparing two Stopping Times is in Sigma Field up to either Stopping Time
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{F} = {\mathcal{B}_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] over $\Omega$ and let $\nu, \nu’ : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ be [[Stopping Time]]s on $\mathcal{F}$.

item.title: Complement of Support of Measure is Union of all Null Open Sets
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{B}(X), \mu)$ be a [[Borel Measure Space]] with [[Borel Measure]] $\mu$. Then $$\text{supp} (\mu)^{C} = {U \subset X : U \text{ is open}, \mu(U) = 0}$$

item.title: Complete Bipartite Graph
item.description: Definition Let $G=(V, E)$ be a [[Bipartite Graph]] with partition ${A, B} \subset \mathcal{P}(V)$. Then we say that $G$ is a [[Complete Bipartite Graph]] if $$E = {{u, v} \in \mathcal{P}(V) : u \in A, v \in B}.

item.title: Complete Graph
item.description: Definition A [[Complete Graph]] is an [[Undirected Graph]] $(V, E)$ s.t. $E = {{v, w} : v,w \in V, v \neq w}$.

item.title: Complete Metric Space
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. We say $M$ is a [[Complete Metric Space]] if for all [[Cauchy Sequence]]s $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset M$, there exists $x \in M$ so that $x_{n} \to x$.

item.title: Complete Ordering
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] on $T$. Then $\leq$ is a [[Complete Ordering]] [[Order Relation|relation]] if for every [[Nonempty]] [[Set]] $A \subset T$ s.

item.title: Completeness of the Real Numbers
item.description: Statement We can state this in the following 6 ways all of which are equivalent: $\mathbb{R}$ with its usual [[Total Ordering]] $\leq$ is a [[Complete Ordering]] Every [[Cauchy Sequence]] of $\mathbb{R}$ [[Sequence Convergence|converges]] in $\mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Components Converge iff Convergence in Product Metric Space
item.description: Statement Let $(M_{i}, d_{i}){i \in I}$ be [[Metric Space]]s with [[Index Set]] $I$ and let $M = \prod\limits{i \in I}^{} M_{i}$ be the [[Product Metric Space]] with [[Supremum Metric]].

item.title: Composition of Continuous Functions is Continuous
item.description: Statement Suppose $X,Y, Z$ are [[Topological Space]]s and $F : X \to Y, G: Y \to Z$ are [[Continuous Function]]s. Then $G \circ F$ is a [[Continuous Function]].

item.title: Concave Function

item.title: Conditional Expectation Exists and is Almost Surely Unique
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] on $\Omega$. Let $\mathcal{G} \subset \mathcal{B}$ be a sub-[[Sigma Algebra]].

item.title: Conditional Expectation is Linear
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X, Y$ be [[Random Variable]]s in $\bar{L^{1}}(\mathcal{B})$. Let $\mathcal{G} \subset \mathcal{B}$ be a sub-[[Sigma Algebra]] of $\mathcal{B}$.

item.title: Conditional Expectation is Non-Decreasing
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{G}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $\mathcal{B} \subset \mathcal{G}$ be a sub-[[Sigma Algebra]] of $\mathcal{G}$. Suppose $X_{1}, X_{2} \in \mathcal{G}$ so that $X_{1} \leq X_{2}$.

item.title: Conditional Expectation over the Trivial Sigma Algebra is Expectation
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] on $\Omega$. Then $$\mathbb{E}[X| {\emptyset, \Omega}] = \mathbb{E}[X]$$

item.title: Conditional Expectation with respect to a Set is Integral divided by Probability
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] in $\bar{L^{1}}(\mathcal{B})$. Suppose $B \in \mathcal{B}$ so that $\mathbb{P}(B) \neq 0$.

item.title: Conditional Expectation with respect to Random Element
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] in $L^{1}(\mathcal{B})$, and let $Y: (\Omega, \mathcal{B}) \to (S, \mathcal{S})$ bea [[Random Element]].

item.title: Conditional Expectation with respect to Sigma Field
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] in $L^{1}(\mathcal{B})$. Let $\mathcal{G} \subset \mathcal{B}$ be a [[Sub-Sigma Algebra]].

item.title: Conditional Probability
item.description: [[TODO]] - need to rope in [[Regular Conditional Distribution]]. This page can be redefined in terms of [[Regular Conditional Distribution]] of [[Identity Function]].

item.title: Conditioning on known information is Idempotent
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{G}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $\mathbb{B} \subset \mathcal{G}$ be a sub-[[Sigma Algebra]] of $\mathbb{G}$. Suppose $X$ is a $\mathcal{B}$-[[Measureable Function|measureable]] [[Random Variable]] on $\Omega$.

item.title: Cone
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and suppose $S \subset V$. $S$ is a [[Cone]] if $\forall \mathbf{u} \in S$ and $\forall a \geq 0$, $$a \mathbf{u} \in S$$.

item.title: Connected
item.description: Definition 1 Suppose $X$ is a [[Topological Space]]. We say $X$ is [[Connected]] if the only pair of [[Set]]s $U, V$ satisfying

item.title: Connected Component
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $C \subset X$ is a [[Connected Component]] of $X$ if $C$ is a [[Maximal]] (wrt [[Subset Relation]]) [[Connected|connected set]].

item.title: Connected Components of Locally Path-Connected Spaces are Open
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Then every [[Connected Component]] $C \subset X$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Connected Components of Topological Manifolds are Open
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. Then every [[Connected Component]] $C \subset X$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Connected Components Partition the Space
item.description: Statement Suppose $X$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then the [[Set|collection]] $$\mathcal{C} := {C \subset X : C \text{ is a nonempty connected component}}$$ is a [[Partition]] of $X$.

item.title: Connectedness is a Topological Invariant
item.description: Statement Suppose $X, Y$ are [[Topological Space]]s and $X \cong Y$. Then $X$ is [[Connected]] [[If and Only If]] $Y$ is.

item.title: Constant Function is a Stopping Time
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{F} = {\mathcal{B}_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] over $\Omega$, $k \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$, and let $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ be defined as $\nu(\omega) = k$ for all $\omega \in \Omega$.

item.title: Constant Functions are Measureable
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{M}$ be any [[Sigma Algebra]] on $X$. Likewise, let $Y$ be a [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{N}$ be any [[Sigma Algebra]] on $Y$.

item.title: Constant Symbol
item.description: Definition Definition A [[Symbol]] representing a constant.

item.title: Construction of Brownian Motion
item.description: [[TODO]] - [[Stat 502 - Probability II]] final exam. [[Brownian Motion]] [[Hilbert Space]] [[L2 is a Hilbert Space]] [[Gaussian Random Variable]] [[Guassian Random Variables are independent iff their Covariance is 0]] [[Independence]] [[Measureable Function applied to Independent Random Variables preserves Independence]] [[Probability Space]]

item.title: Continuity Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $(X_{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Variable]] (on arbitrary [[Probability Space]]s) so that $X{n}$ has [[Characteristic Function]] $\phi_{n}$ for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Continuous Bijections from Compact Space to a Hausdorff Space are Homeomorphisms
item.description: Statement Suppose $X$ is a [[Compact]] space, $Y$ is a [[Hausdorff]] space, and $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Continuous Function|continuous]] [[Bijection]].

item.title: Continuous Function
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(X, \tau), (Y, \rho)$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. Then $f$ is a [[Continuous Function]] if $\forall V \in \rho$ $$f^{-1}(V) \in \tau$$

item.title: Continuous Functions are Determined on Dense Sets
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$, $(Y, \rho)$ are [[Topological Space]]s, $Y$ is [[Hausdorff|Hausdorff]], and $f: X \to Y$, $g: X \to Y$ are [[Continuous Function|continuous functions]].

item.title: Continuous Functions form a Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]], and let $V$ be a [[Topological Vector Space]] over [[Topological Field]] $F$. Then $C(X, V)$ forms a [[Vector Space]] over $F$.

item.title: Continuous Functions from a Compact Space to a Hausdorff Space are Closed Maps
item.description: Statement Suppose $X$ is a [[Compact]] space, $Y$ is a [[Hausdorff]] space, and $f: X \to Y$ is [[Continuous Function|continuous]]. Then $f$ is a [[Closed Map]].

item.title: Continuous Functions on a Compact Set are Banach
item.description: Statement Let $K$ be a [[Compact]] [[Topological Space]] and suppose $(Y, |\cdot|)$ is a [[Banach Space]] over $\mathbb{K}$. Then $C(K, Y)$, the space of [[Continuous Function]]s, is a [[Banach Space]] over $\mathbb{K}$ when equipped with the [[Supremum Norm]].

item.title: Continuous Functions Preserve Compactness
item.description: Statement Let $K, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $K$ is [[Compact]]. Let $f: K \to Y$ be a [[Continuous Function]].

item.title: Continuous Functions Preserve Connectedness
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $X$ be [[Connected]]. Then if $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Continuous Function]], $f(X)$ is also [[Connected]].

item.title: Continuous Functions Preserve Limit Points
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \tau), (Y, \rho)$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $f: X \to Y$ is [[Continuous Function]]. Suppose $S \subset X$.

item.title: Continuous Functions Preserve Path-Connectedness
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $X$ is [[Path-Connected]]. Then if $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Continuous Function]], $f(X)$ is also [[Path-Connected]].

item.title: Continuous Functions Preserve Sequence Limits
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \tau), (Y, \rho)$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $f: X \to Y$ is [[Continuous Function]]. Suppose $(x_n) \subset X$.

item.title: Continuous Mapping Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $({X_n}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Variable]]s such that $$X_{n} \Rightarrow X_{0}.$$ Assume $F_{n}$ is the [[Probability Distribution Function]] for $X_{n}$ for $n \geq 0$.

item.title: Continuous Open Maps transfer Bases
item.description: Statement Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $X$ have [[Topological Basis]] $\mathcal{B}$. Suppose there exists [[Continuous Function|continuous]] [[Open Map]] $F:X \to Y$.

item.title: Continuous Path
item.description: Definition 1 Let $Y$ be a [[Topological Space]]. A [[Continuous Path]] from $x \in Y$ to $y \in Y$ is a [[Continuous Function]] $f: [0,1] \to Y$ s.

item.title: Continuous Support of a Random Variable
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}^{n}$ be a [[Continuous Random Variable]] with [[Probability Density Function]] $f_{X} : \mathbb{R}^{n} \to \mathbb{R}{\geq 0}$.

item.title: Convergence Almost Surely does not imply convergence of moments
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. There exists a sequence of [[Random Variable]]s $(X_n){n=1}^{\infty}$ on $\Omega$ s.t. $X{n} \to X$ but $\mathbb{E}|X_{n}| \not\to \mathbb{E}|X|$.

item.title: Convergence in L1 implies convergence of Integrals
item.description: Statement [[TODO]] [[L1 Integrable Functions]] [[Sequence Convergence]] [[Integration]] If $f_{n} \overset{L^{1}}{\to} f$, then $\int\limits f_{n} \to \int\limits f$. This follows because

item.title: Convergence of a Bounded Sequence is determined by Convergent Subsequences
item.description: Statement Let $(a_{n}) \subset \mathbb{R}$ be a [[Bounded Sequence]]. Then $a_{n} \to a \in \mathbb{R}$ [[If and Only If|iff]] every [[Sequence Convergence|convergent]] [[Subsequence]] of $(a_{n})$ converges to $a$.

item.title: Convergent Sequences are Cauchy
item.description: Statement Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] and let $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset M$. If $x_{n} \to x \in M$, then $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ is a [[Cauchy Sequence]].

item.title: Convex Combination
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $x_{1}, \dots, x_{n} \in V$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Suppose $\lambda_{1}, \dots, \lambda_{n} \in [0,1]$ and $\sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} \lambda_{i} = 1$.

item.title: Convex Cone
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $S \subset V$. Then $S$ is a [[Convex Cone]] if $\forall a, b \geq 0$ we have that $$a \mathbf{u} + b \mathbf{v} \in S$$ $\forall \mathbf{u}, \mathbf{v} \in S$.

item.title: Convex Function
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$, let $S \subset V$ be a [[Convex Set]], and suppose $f: S \to \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Convex Hull
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. Then the [[Convex Hull]] of $S$, denoted $\mathbf{conv} S$, is defined as $$\mathbf{conv} S := \bigcap\limits {T \subset V : S \subset T, T \text{ is convex}}.

item.title: Convex Polytope
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$. $P \subset V$ is a [[Convex Polytope]] if there exist [[Closed Halfspace]]s $H_{1}, \dots, H_{n}$ for $n \in \mathbb{N}$ so that $$P = \bigcap\limits_{i = 1}^{n} H_{i}$$

item.title: Convex Polytope Face
item.description: Definition 1 Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $P \subset V$ be a [[Convex Polytope]]. Then a [[Set]] $F \subset P$ is a [[Convex Polytope Face|face]] of $P$ if any of the following is true:

item.title: Convex Set
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $S \subset V$. $S$ is a [[Convex Set]] if for all $\lambda \in [0,1]$ and all $u, v \in S$ $$\lambda u + (1 - \lambda) v \in S$$

item.title: Convex Sets contain their Expectation
item.description: [[TODO]] - This will pull together [[Vector Space]], [[Probability Space]], and [[Expectation]]

item.title: Coordinate Ball
item.description: Definition Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. Let $(U, \varphi)$ be a [[Coordinate Chart]] for $M$ and let $\hat{B} \subset \varphi(U)$ be an [[Open Ball]] in $\mathbb{R}^{n}$.

item.title: Coordinate Balls form a Basis for Manifolds
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. Then $$\mathcal{B} := {B \subset M : B \text{ is a coordinate ball}}$$ is a [[Topological Basis]] for $M$.

item.title: Correspondence of Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measures and Distribution Functions
item.description: Statement If $F: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ is a [[Distribution Function]], then there is a unique [[Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measure]] $\mu_{F}$ on $\mathbb{R}$ such that $\mu_{F}((a,b]) = F(b) - F(a)$ for all $b > a \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Correspondence of Partition Sets means Partitions are the same
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{P}, \mathcal{R}$ be two [[Partition]]s of $X$. If for each $P \in \mathcal{P}$ there exists $R \in \mathcal{R}$ s.

item.title: Correspondence of Surjective Functions, Partitions, and Equivalence Relations
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Then the following [[Class]]es can be naturally transformed from one to the other: [[Partition]]s of $X$.

item.title: Countable Additivity of Measures
item.description: See property (2) in the definition of a [[Measure]]

item.title: Countable Set Sigma Algebra
item.description: Statement Let $S$ be a [[Set]]. Then the [[Set|Collection]] $$\mathcal{M} = {E \subset S : E \text{ is countable or }E^{C} \text{ is countable}}$$ is a [[Sigma Algebra]].

item.title: Countable Set Sigma Algebra is Generated by Singletons
item.description: Statement Let $S$ be a [[Set]]. Then $\sigma({{s} \subset S : s \in S})$ is the [[Countable Set Sigma Algebra]] on $S$.

item.title: Cross-Entropy
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Then the [[Cross-Entropy]] of a [[Soft Classifier]] $g$ is $$\begin{align*} CE(g) &= \mathbb{E}\Big[-\sum\limits_{y \in [n]} 1_{Y=y} \log g(X)_{y} \Big] \end{align*}$$

item.title: Dense
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $D \subset X$ is Dense if the [[Closure]] of $D$ is $X$.

item.title: Differential Entropy
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Continuous Random Variable]] with [[Probability Density Function]] $f_{X} : \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$. Then the [[Differential Entropy]], $\mathbb{H}(X)$ is

item.title: Differential Entropy of Uniform Random Variable
item.description: Statement Let $X \sim \text{Unif}[a, b]$ for some $a < b \in \mathbb{R}$. Then $$\mathbb{H}(X) = \log(b - a)$$ Proof Recall that the [[Probability Density Function of the Continuous Uniform Distribution]] is $f_{X} = \frac{1}{b-a} \mathbb{1}{[a, b]}$.

item.title: Dimension of a Vector Space
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Finite-Dimensional Vector Space]] and let $S$ be a [[Vector Space Basis]] for $V$. Then $\dim V = |S|$.

item.title: Dimension of a Vector Space lower bounds Spanning Set size
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] with [[Dimension of a Vector Space|dimension]] $\dim V = n$ for some $n \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Dimension of a Vector Space upper bounds Linearly Independent Set sizee
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] with [[Dimension of a Vector Space|dimension]] $\dim V = n$ for some $n \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Dimension of Subspace cannot be bigger than Parent Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] and let $W \subset V$ be a [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$. Then $\dim W \leq \dim V$.

item.title: Direct Product Normed Space
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||{X}), (Y, ||\cdot||{Y})$ be [[Normed Vector Space]]s. Then the [[Direct Product Vector Space]] $X \times Y$ equipped with a [[p-norm]] $||\cdot||{p} : X \times Y \to \mathbb{R}{\geq 0}$ defined as $$||(x, y)||_{p} := (||x||^{p} + ||y||^{p})^{\frac{1}{p}}$$ forms a [[Normed Vector Space]].

item.title: Direct Product Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $V$, $W$ be [[Vector Space]]s over [[Field]] $F$. Then $V \times W$ equipped with [[Additive Identity]] $(0, 0)$.

item.title: Directed Graph
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Set]] and suppose $E \subset V \times V$. Then $(V, E)$ is a [[Directed Graph]] with [[Graph Vertex|vertices]] $v \in V$ and [[Graph Edge|edges]] $e \in E$.

item.title: Directed Partial Ordering
item.description: Definition Let $A$ be a [[Partial Ordering]]. We call $A$ a [[Directed Partial Ordering]] if $\forall \alpha, \beta \in A$ $\exists \gamma \in A$ s.

item.title: Discrete Metric
item.description: Statement Let $S$ be a [[Set]]. The [[Function]] $d: S \times S \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ defined $$d(x, y) = \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if } x \neq y \ 0 & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$$ is a [[Distance Function]].

item.title: Discrete Metric induces the Discrete Topology
item.description: Statement Let $S$ be a [[Set]] equipped with the [[Discrete Metric]], $d$. Then the [[Metric Topology]] induced by $d$ is the [[Discrete Topology]] on $S$.

item.title: Discrete Support of a Random Element
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $(S, \mathcal{M})$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $X : \Omega \to S$ be a [[Random Element]].

item.title: Discrete Topology
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Then $\mathcal{P}(X)$ is a [[Topological Space|topology]] on $X$. It is known as the [[Discrete Topology]].

item.title: Discrete-Time Filtration
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. The [[Set|Collection]] $\mathcal{F} = {\mathcal{B}_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ is a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] if $\mathcal{F}$ is a [[Filtration]] wrt [[Index Set]] $\mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Discrete-Time Process
item.description: Definition A [[Discrete-Time Process]] is a [[Stochastic Process]] for which the [[Total Ordering|totally ordered]] [[Index Set]] is $\mathbb{N}$. Other Outlinks [[Natural Numbers]] [[Discrete-Time Filtration]]

item.title: Disjoint Compact Sets are Separable from each other in a Hausdorff Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Hausdorff]] [[Topological Space]]. Then if $K, L \subset X$ are [[Compact]] and $K \cap L = \emptyset$, then there exists $U, V \subset X$ [[Open]] so that

item.title: Disjoint Sets
item.description: Definition Let $A$, $B$ be two [[Set]]s. We say $A$ and $B$ are [[Disjoint Sets]] if $A \cap B = \emptyset$.

item.title: Distance Function
item.description: Definition 1 Let $S$ be a [[Set]]. A [[Distance Function]] on $S$ is a [[Function]] of the form $d: S^{2} \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ that satisfies the following properties:

item.title: Distribution
item.description: Suppose $X$ is a [[Random Variable]] on [[Probability Space]] $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ with [[Distribution Function]] $F_{X}$ and [[Induced Probability Measure]] $\mu$.

item.title: Distribution Function
item.description: Definition Let $F: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$. Then $F$ is a distribution function if $F$ is [[Non-Decreasing Function]] $F$ is [[Right-Continuous]] Denote $F(\infty)= \lim_{x \to \infty}F(x)$ and $F(-\infty)= \lim_{x \to -\infty}F(x)$.

item.title: Dot Product of Random Vector and Independent Entry Random Vector
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Suppose $(X_n)$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Random Variable]]s and $(Y_{n})$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Independence|Independent]] [[Random Variable]]s that is also independent with $X_{n}$ for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Elementary Class
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. We say that a [[Class]] of $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure]]s, $\mathcal{K}$ is an [[Elementary Class]] if there is an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Theory]] $T$ such that $\mathcal{K} = {\mathcal{M} : \mathcal{M} \models T}$.

item.title: Elementary Row Operation
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $m \in \mathbb{N}$. Let $F^{m \times \cdot} = \bigcup\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} F^{m \times n}$.

item.title: Elementary Row Operations are Invertible by other Elementary Row Operations
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]], let $m, n \in \mathbb{N}$, $e \in \text{Row}F^{m \times \cdot}$. Then there exists $e’ \in \text{Row}F^{m \times \cdot}$ of the same type so that $\forall A \in F^{m \times \cdot}$, $$e’(e(A)) = A = e(e’(A))$$

item.title: Empty Set
item.description: Axiom $$\exists B \forall x (x \not\in B)$$ This [[Axiom]] states the existence of a [[Set]] for which no element belongs to.

item.title: Epigraph
item.description: Definition Suppose $X$ is a [[Set]], $(Y, \leq)$ is a [[Partial Ordering]], $f: X \to Y$. The [[Epigraph]] of $f$ is the [[Set]] $$\text{Epi}(f) = {(x, y) \in X \times Y : y \geq f(x)}$$

item.title: Epsilon Principle
item.description: Statement Let $a,b \in \mathbb{R}$. Suppose for all $\epsilon > 0$, we have that $a \geq b - \epsilon$. Then $a \geq b$.

item.title: Equal in Distribution
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Random Variable]]s and let $F_{X}, F_{Y}: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be their respective [[Probability Distribution Function]]s. Then $X \overset{\text{d}}{=} Y$ ($X, Y$ are [[Equal in Distribution]]), if $F_{X}$ = $F_{Y}$.

item.title: Equation System
item.description: Definition Let $S, R$ be a [[Set]]s, and let ${f_{\alpha}\in R^{S}}{\alpha \in A}$ and ${b{\alpha} \in R}{\alpha \in A}$ for some [[Index Set]] $A$.

item.title: Equation System Constants
item.description: Definition $S, R$ be a [[Set]]s. Consider the [[Equation System]] defined by $$f_{\alpha}(x)= b_{\alpha} \text{ }\forall \alpha \in A$$ where ${f_{\alpha}\in R^{S}}{\alpha \in A}$ and ${b{\alpha} \in R}{\alpha \in A}$ for some [[Index Set]] $A$.

item.title: Equation System Functions
item.description: Definition $S, R$ be a [[Set]]s. Consider the [[Equation System]] defined by $$f_{\alpha}(x)= b_{\alpha} \text{ }\forall \alpha \in A$$ where ${f_{\alpha}\in R^{S}}{\alpha \in A}$ and ${b{\alpha} \in R}{\alpha \in A}$ for some [[Index Set]] $A$.

item.title: Equivalence Class
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $\sim$ be an [[Equivalence Relation]] on $X$. If $\mathcal{S}$ is the [[Partition]] of $X$ corresponding to $\sim$ (as per [[Correspondence of Surjective Functions, Partitions, and Equivalence Relations]]), then we call the elements $\mathcal{S}$ the [[Equivalence Class]]es of $\sim$.

item.title: Equivalence Relation
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $R \subset X \times X$ be a [[Relation]] on $X$. Then $R$ is an [[Equivalence Relation]] if it is a [[Preorder Relation]] with the following additional property:

item.title: Equivalent Conditions for being a Sigma Field up to a Stopping Time
item.description: Statement Let ${\mathcal{B}_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\Omega$ and let $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$. Then the following [[Sigma Algebra]]s are equal:

item.title: Equivalent Conditions for being a Stopping Time
item.description: Statement Suppose ${\mathcal{B}_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N} }$ is a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\Omega$. Let $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$. [[The following are Equivalent]]:

item.title: Equivalent Conditions for Convexity
item.description: Statement Suppose $V$ is a [[Vector Space]] of $\mathbb{R}$ and $f: V \to \mathbb{R}$. Then [[The following are Equivalent]]: $f$ is a [[Convex Function]] The [[Epigraph]] of $f$, $\text{Epi}(f) \subset V \times \mathbb{R}$ (endowed with the [[Product Vector Space]]), is a [[Convex Set]].

item.title: Equivalent Conditions for Local Compactness of Hausdorff Spaces
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Hausdorff]] [[Topological Space]]. Then [[The following are Equivalent]]: $X$ is [[Locally Compact]]. Each $p \in X$ has a [[Precompact]] [[Open|neighborhood]].

item.title: Equivalent Definitions of Locally Euclidean
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then [[The following are Equivalent]]: $M$ is [[Locally Euclidean]] of dimension $n$ For each $p \in M$, there exists a [[Coordinate Chart]] containing $p$ to $\mathbb{R}^{n}$ For each $p \in M$, there exists a [[Coordinate Chart]] containing $p$ to $B(\mathbb{R}^{n})$ Proof $(2) \Rightarrow (1)$: Since $\mathbb{R}^{n}$ is [[Open]] (by definition of a [[Topological Space]]), we have for each $p \in M$ an [[Open]] $U \ni p$ and [[Open]] $\hat{U} = \mathbb{R}^{n}$ that is [[Homeomorphism|homeomorphic]] to $U$.

item.title: Equivalent Formulas
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. Two $\mathcal{L}$-[[Formula]]s $\phi, \psi$ are [[Equivalent Formulas]] if $$\mathcal{M } \models_{\sigma} \phi \Leftrightarrow \mathcal{M} \models_{\sigma} \psi$$ for any $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]] $\mathcal{M}$ and any [[Assignment]] $\sigma$.

item.title: Equivalent Norms

item.title: Euclidean Space is Second Countable

Proof Consider the collection $$\mathcal{B} := {B_{\delta}(x) : \delta \in \mathbb{Q}, x \in \mathbb{Q}^{n}}$$ It is [[Countable]] ([[A Union of Countable Sets is Countable]], [[Rationals are Countable]], and [[Finite Products of Countable Sets dare Countable]]).

item.title: Euler's Formula
item.description: Statement Suppose $r, \theta \in \mathbb{R}$ so that $r \geq 0$. Then $$re^{it \theta} = r \cos \theta + i r \sin \theta$$

item.title: Every Connected Component is Closed

item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Then if $U \subset X$ is [[Open]], it is [[Locally Path-Connected]].

item.title: Every Preorder Relation induces an Order Relation
item.description: Statement Let $(P, R)$ be a [[Preorder]]. Then there exists an [[Equivalence Relation]] $\sim$ on $P$ so that $(P/\sim,R/\sim)$ is a [[Partial Ordering]].

item.title: Every Sequence in a Compact Set has a Convergent Subsequence
Every Sequence on the Reals contains a Monotone Subsequence
item.description: Statement Let $(a_{n}) \subset \mathbb{R}$ be a [[Sequence]]. Then there exists a [[Subsequence]] $(a_{n_{k}})$ that is [[Monotone Sequence|monotone]]. Proof 1 Consider the [[Complete Graph]] on $\mathbb{N}$, $K_{\mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Every Subsequence of a Convergent Sequence converges to the same Limit
item.description: Statement Let $(a_{n}) \subset X$ be a sequence in [[Metric Space]] $(X, d)$. If $a_{n} \to a \in X$ every [[Subsequence]] of $(a_{n})$ [[Sequence Convergence|converges]] to $a$.

item.title: Extended Natural Numbers
item.description: Definition The [[Extended Natural Numbers]] is the set $\bar{\mathbb{N}} := \mathbb{N} \cup {\infty}$ where $\infty$ has the following properties $\forall n \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$, $\infty \geq n$ $\forall n \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$, $\infty + n = \infty$ $\forall n \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$, $\infty * n = \infty$ That is, the [[Extended Natural Numbers]] is a [[Compactification]] of $\mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Extended Real Numbers
item.description: Definition 1 We define the [[Extended Real Numbers]] as $$\bar{R} := \mathbb{R} \cup {-\infty, \infty}$$ where $-\infty < x < \infty$ $\forall x \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Integration is Non-Decreasing
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $f,g: X \to \mathbb{R}$ be [[Borel Measureable Function]]s so that $f \leq g$ $\mu$-[[Almost Everywhere]].

item.title: Integration of a Nonnegative Function is 0 iff the Function is 0 Almost Everywhere

item.title: Interesting Topics
item.description: [[Wasserstein Distance]] - [[2022-04-14]] AKA [[Earth Mover Distance]] distance between [[Probability Distribution Function|probability distributions]]. [[Gradient Flow]] - [[2022-04-14]]

item.title: Interior of Convex Set is Convex
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Topological Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $S \subset V$ be a [[Convex Set]]. Then $\text{int} S$ is a [[Convex Set]].

item.title: Intersection of Affine Sets is Affine
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on $\mathbb{R}$ and let $\mathcal{S} \subset \mathcal{P}(V)$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Affine Set]]s. Then $\bigcap\limits_{S \in \mathcal{S}}S$ is a [[Affine Set]].

item.title: Intersection of Closed Sets is Closed
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $\mathcal{K} \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$ is a collection of [[Closed|closed sets]] in $X$. Then $\bigcap\limits \mathcal{K}$ is [[Closed]] in $X$.

item.title: Intersection of Convex Sets is Convex
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on $\mathbb{R}$ and let $\mathcal{S} \subset \mathcal{P}(V)$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Convex Set]]s. Then $\bigcap\limits_{S \in \mathcal{S}}S$ is a [[Convex Set]].

item.title: Intersection of Vector Subspaces is a Vector Subspace
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$ and let ${W_{\alpha} \subset V}{\alpha \in A}$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Vector Subspace]]s of $V$.

item.title: Intersection Sigma Algebra
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \mathcal{M})$ is a [[Measure Space]] and let $A \subset X$. Then the collection $$\mathcal{M} \cap A := {E \cap A : E \in \mathcal{M}}$$ is the [[Intersection Sigma Algebra]] on $A$.

item.title: Inverse Reinforcement Learning
item.description: [[TODO]] - see paper by [[Stuart Russell]] and [[Andrew Ng]]

item.title: Inverting Right Continuous Inverses does not decrease
item.description: Statement Suppose $F: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ is a [[Distribution Function]] and denote $F^{\rightarrow}$ to be its [[Right Continuous Inverse]]. Then $\forall x \in \mathbb{R}$:

item.title: Kolmogorov Convergence Criterion
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(X_{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Independence|independent]] [[Centered Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$.

item.title: Kolmogorov Strong Law of Large Numbers
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(X_{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Independently and Identically Distributed|iid]] [[Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$.

item.title: Kolmogorov Three Series Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(X_{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Independence|independent]] [[Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$.

item.title: Konig's Theorem
item.description: Statement Suppose $G = (V, E)$ is a [[Bipartite Graph]]. Then the [[Vertex Cover and Matching Duality]] is strict. That is, $\tau(G) = \nu(G)$.

item.title: Kroenecker Delta Function
item.description: Definition The [[Kroenecker Delta Function]], $\delta: \mathbb{N} \times \mathbb{N} \to {0, 1}$ is defined as $$\delta_{ij} := \delta(i, j) := \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if } i = j \ 0 & \text{otherwise} \end{cases}$$

item.title: L-Plus Functions
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]]. Then the [[Set]] of [[L-Plus Functions]] is defined as $$L^{+} = {f: X \to [0, \infty]: f \text{ is }\mathcal{M}\text{-measureable}}$$

item.title: L1 is a Complete Metric Space
item.description: [[TODO]] [[L1 Integrable Functions]] [[Complete Metric Space]] [[Sequence Convergence]]

item.title: Language
item.description: Definition A [[Language]] $\mathcal{L}$ is a [[Tuple]] $(\mathcal{F}, \mathcal{R}, \mathcal{C}, n_{\mathcal{R}}, n_{\mathcal{F}})$ where $\mathcal{F}$ is a [[Set]] of [[Function Symbol]]s $\mathcal{R}$ is a [[Set]] of [[Relation Symbol]]s $\mathcal{C}$ is a [[Set]] of [[Constant Symbol]]s $n_\mathcal{R} : \mathcal{R} \to \mathbb{N}$ is a [[Function]] that maps each [[Relation]] [[Symbol]] to it’s respective [[Arity]] Remarks [[Language]]s do not actually give any meaning to their [[Symbol]]s.

item.title: Language Structure
item.description: Definition An $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]] $\mathcal{M}$ is a [[Tuple]] $(M, \mathcal{F}^{\mathcal{M}}, \mathcal{R}^{\mathcal{M}}, \mathcal{C}^{\mathcal{M}})$ where $M$ is a [[Nonempty]] [[Set]] called the [[Universe|universe, domain, or underlying set]] of $\mathcal{M}$.

item.title: Law
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]], and let $(S, \Sigma)$ be a [[Measure Space]].

item.title: Least Upper Bound Property
item.description: See [[Complete Ordering]]

item.title: Lebesgue Measure
item.description: Definition The [[Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measure]] with [[Distribution Function]] $\text{id}_\mathbb{R}$. Other Outlinks [[Correspondence of Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measures and Distribution Functions]] [[Identity Function]]

item.title: Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measure
item.description: Definition A [[Lebesgue-Stieltjes Measure]] is a [[Borel Measure]] $\mu$ on $\mathcal{B}(\mathbb{R})$ s.t. $\mu(I) < \infty$ for all [[Bounded Set|bounded]] [[Interval]]s of $\mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Lee - Introduction to Smooth Manifolds
item.description: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1s5D0RsSwpET7EqEOimO09imN-jZmaxYF/view?usp=sharing

item.title: Left and Right Inverses in an Abelian Group are the Unique Inverse
item.description: Statement Suppose $G$ is an [[Abelian Group]] and $u, v \in G$. Further suppose $v$ is a [[Left Inverse]]/[[Right Inverse]] of $u$.

item.title: Left Continuous Inverse
item.description: Definition Let $F: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a [[Distribution Function]]. The [[Left Continuous Inverse]] of $F$ is defined $$F^{\leftarrow}(x) = \inf{s \in \mathbb{R} : F(s) \geq x}$$

item.title: Left Function Limit
item.description: Definition Let $f: \mathbb{R} \to M$ be a [[Function]] where $(M, d)$ is a [[Metric Space]] and let $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Left Ordered Group
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be a [[Group]] and let $\leq$ be a [[Total Ordering]] on $G$. Then we say $G$ is a [[Left Ordered Group]] if $\forall g, h, h’ \in G$ $$h \leq h’ \Rightarrow gh \leq gh’$$

item.title: Left-Continuous
item.description: Definition A [[Function]] $f: \mathbb{R} \to M$ for [[Metric Space]] at $(M, d)$ is [[Left-Continuous]] at $x \in \mathbb{R}$ if its [[Left Function Limit]] exists and, $$\lim_{y \uparrow x} f(y) = f(x)$$ We call $f$ [[Left-Continuous]] if it is [[Left-Continuous]] for all $x \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Levy's Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $({X}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Independence|independent]] [[Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$.

item.title: Likelihood Soft Classifier
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. The [[Likelihood Soft Classifier]] is a [[Soft Classifier]] $g: \mathcal{D} \to [0,1]^{n}$ so that for $x \in \mathcal{D}$

item.title: Liminf of Indicator Sequence is Indicator of Liminf
item.description: Statement Let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Set]]s. Then $$\liminf\limits_{n \to \infty} \mathbb{1}{A{n}} = \mathbb{1}{\liminf\limits{n \to \infty} A_{n}}.$$

item.title: Liminf of Set Sequence
item.description: Let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Set]]s. Then $$\liminf\limits_{n \to \infty} A_{n} = \bigcup\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} \bigcap\limits_{k \geq n} A_{k}.$$

item.title: Limit of a Monotonic Set Sequence
item.description: Definition Let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Set]]s. Then if $(A_{n})$ is [[Non-Decreasing Function]] $$\lim\limits_{n \to \infty} A_{n} = \bigcup\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} A_{n},$$ an if $(A_{n})$ is [[Non-Increasing Function]] then $$\lim\limits_{n \to \infty} A_{n} = \bigcap\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} A_{n}.

item.title: Limit Point
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Let $S \subset X$. Then $x \in X$ is a [[Limit Point]] of $S$ if $\forall U \in \tau$ such that $x \in U$, we have that $U$ and $S$ are not [[Mutually Disjoint]].

item.title: Limit Points of a subset are Limit Points of the original Set
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]] and let $T \subset S \subset X$. Then if $x \in X$ is a [[Limit Point]] of $T$, it is also a [[Limit Point]] of $S$.

item.title: Limsup of Indicator Sequence is Indicator of Limsup
item.description: Statement Let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Set]]s. Then $$\limsup\limits_{n \to \infty} \mathbb{1}{A{n}} = \mathbb{1}{\limsup\limits{n \to \infty} A_{n}}.$$

item.title: Limsup of Set Sequence
item.description: Let $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Set]]s. Then $$\limsup\limits_{n \to \infty} A_{n} = \bigcap\limits_{n \in \mathbb{N}} \bigcup\limits_{k \geq n} A_{k}.$$

item.title: Line
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and $x_{1}, x_{2} \in V$. The [[Line]] $L \subset V$ containing $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ is the [[Set]] $$L = {\lambda x_{1} + (1 - \lambda) x_{2} : \lambda \in \mathbb{R}}$$

item.title: Linear Combination
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$ and let $\mathbf{x}{1}, \dots \mathbf{x}{n} \in V$ for some $n \in \mathbb{Z}{\geq 0}$.

item.title: Linear Equation System
item.description: Definition Let $V, W$ be [[Vector Space]]s over the same [[Field]] $F$. Then an [[Equation System]] from $V$ to $W$ is a [[Linear Equation System]] if its [[Equation System Functions]] are [[Linear Operator]]s.

item.title: Linear Matrix Inequality
item.description: Definition [[TODO]] see [[Boyd - Convex Optimization]] page 38
