item.title: Linear Program
item.description: [[TODO]] Build down deeper into general constrained optimization programs Definition Suppose $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}$.

item.title: Linearly Dependent
item.description: Definition 1 Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$. Let $S \subset V$. $S$ is [[Linearly Dependent]] if there exists a [[Finite Set|finite]] subset ${\mathbf{a}{i}}{i=1}^{n}$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$ and constants $c_{1}, \dots, c_{n} \in F$ so that

item.title: Linearly Independent
item.description: Definition 1 Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$. Let $S \subset V$. $S$ is [[Linearly Independent]] if it is not [[Linearly Dependent]]

item.title: Linearly Independent Set Size is Unbounded iff there exists an Infinite Linearly Independent Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $\forall n \in \mathbb{N}$ there exists [[Linearly Independent]] $S \subset V$ so that $|S| > n$ [[If and Only If]] there exists [[Linearly Independent]] $R \subset V$ so that $|R| = \infty$.

item.title: little-lp is a Banach Space
item.description: Statement Let $1 \leq p \leq \infty$. $l_{p}$ equipped with its [[Norm]] $||\cdot||_{p}$ is a [[Banach Space]]. Proof 1 [[Lp Spaces are Banach]] [[lp

item.title: little-lp Space
item.description: Definition 1 Let $1 \leq p \leq \infty$. We define $l_{p}$ for $p < \infty$ as $$l_{p} := {({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset \mathbb{R} : \sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} |x_{n}|^{p} < \infty}$$ equipped with the norm $||x||{p} := \left(\sum\limits{n=1}^{\infty}x^{p}\right)^{\frac{1}{p}}$ for $x \in l_{p}$.

item.title: Local Path-Connectedness is a Topological Invariant
item.description: Statement Suppose $X, Y$ are [[Topological Space]]s and $X \cong Y$. Then $X$ is [[Locally Path-Connected]] [[If and Only If]] $Y$ is.

item.title: Locally Compact
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $X$ is [[Locally Compact]] if for all $x \in X$, there exists a[[Open|neighborhood]] of $x$ that is a [[Subset Relation|subset]] of a [[Compact]] [[Set]].

item.title: Locally Euclidean
item.description: Definition Let $M$ be a [[Topological Space]]. We say $M$ is [[Locally Euclidean]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$ if for each point $p \in M$, there exists a [[Coordinate Chart]] containing $p$.

item.title: Locally Path-Connected
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then we say $X$ is [[Locally Path-Connected]] if there exists a [[Topological Basis]] for $X$ of [[Path-Connected]] [[Set]]s.

item.title: Locally Path-Connected Spaces are Path-Connected iff they are Connected
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Then $X$ is [[Path-Connected]] [[If and Only If]] $X$ is [[Connected]]

item.title: Log Concavity Inequality
item.description: Statement Let $a, b > 0$ and let $0 \leq \lambda \leq 1$. Then the following inequality holds $$a^{\lambda}b^{1-\lambda} \leq \lambda a + (1-\lambda) b$$ with equality [[If and Only If]] $\lambda = 0$ or $1$, or $a=b$.

item.title: Lower Bound
item.description: Definition Let $(P, \leq)$ be a [[Partial Ordering]] and let $A \subset P$. $x \in P$ is an [[Upper Bound]] for $A$ if $\forall a \in A$, $p \geq a$.

item.title: Lp Norm
item.description: See [[Lp Space]]

item.title: Lp Space
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]], let $\mathbb{K} = \mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$, and let $p \in [1, \infty]$.

item.title: Magnitude is a Norm
item.description: Statement $\mathbb{C}$ equipped with $|\cdot|$ is a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Proof Follows from [[Complex Numbers]] as an [[Inner Product Space]] and [[Inner Products induce Norms]].

item.title: Manifolds have a Countable Basis of Precompact Coordinate Balls
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. Then there exists a [[Topological Basis]], $\mathcal{B}$, for $M$ s.

item.title: Markov Process
item.description: [[TODO]] - flesh out [[Conditional Probability]] then come back to this. Definition 1 Let ${X_{n} : \Omega \to S}{n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Adapted Process]] to [[Filtration]] ${\mathcal{F}{n}}{n \in \mathbb{N}}$ on [[Probability Space]] $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ with [[Total Ordering]] $T$ and [[Countable]] [[State Space]] $S$.

item.title: Martingale
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $X: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}^{T}$ be an [[Adapted Process]] wrt [[Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{B}{t})_{t \in T}$ on $\Omega$.

item.title: Martingale Convergence Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] . Let $(X_{n}){n \geq 1}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Process|discrete-time]] [[Submartingale]] wrt [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{F}{n} \subset \mathcal{B}){n \in \mathbb{N}}$ so that $\sup\limits_{n \geq 1} \mathbb{E}(X_{n})^{+} < \infty$.

item.title: Martingale Difference Sequence
item.description: Definition Let $(d_{j})$ be a [[Discrete-Time Process]] [[Adapted Process|adapted]] to [[Filtration]] $(\mathcal{B}_{j})$ with [[State Space]] $\mathbb{R}$. Then, it is a [[Martingale Difference Sequence]] if

item.title: Matching
item.description: Definition Let $G = (V, E)$ be an [[Undirected Graph]]. A [[Matching]] is a [[Set]] $M \subset E$ so that $\forall u \in V$, $|{e \in M : u \cap e \neq \emptyset}| \leq 1$.

item.title: Matching Alternating Path
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is an [[Undirected Graph]] and $M \subset E(G)$ is a [[Matching]] on $G$. A [[Graph Path]] $P$ on $G$ from [[Graph Vertex|vertex]] $u \in V(G)$ to $v \in V(G)$ of length $n \in \mathbb{N}$ is an $M$-[[Matching Alternating Path|alternating path]] if its [[Graph Edge|edges]] are alternately in $P$.

item.title: Matching Alternating Tree
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is an [[Undirected Graph]] and $M$ is a [[Matching]] on $G$. Suppose $(T, r)$ is a [[Rooted Tree]] [[Subgraph]] of $G$.

item.title: Matching Augmenting Path
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is an [[Undirected Graph]] and $M \subset E(G)$ is a [[Matching]] on $G$. Suppose $P$ is an $M$-[[Matching Alternating Path|Alternating Path]] on $G$ of length $n \in \mathbb{N}$ from $u \in V(G)$ to $v \in V(G)$.

item.title: Matching Covered
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]] and let $M \subset E(G)$ be a [[Matching]] on $G$. we say that $v \in V(G)$ is [[Matching Covered|covered]] by $M$ if $$|{e \in M : u \cap e \neq \emptyset}| = 1.

item.title: Matching Exposed
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]] and let $M \subset E(G)$ be a [[Matching]] on $G$. we say that $v \in V(G)$ is [[Matching Exposed|exposed]] by $M$ if $v$ is not [[Matching Covered|covered]] by $M$.

item.title: Math Wiki
item.description: Welcome to my math-wiki! To get started check out [[A Set is Closed iff it is its own Closure]]. [[Conditional Expectation]] [[Vector Space]] [[Bayes Classifier]] I’ve been building this wiki since early 2022 as a way to

item.title: Matrix
item.description: Definition Let $S$ be a [[Set]] and let $m,n \in \mathbb{N}$. We say $(A_{ij} \in S)_{i \in [n], j \in [m]}$ is a [[Matrix]].

item.title: Matrix Equation System
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]]. And consider a [[Finite Equation System]] of [[Order of an Equation System|order]] $m$ $$f_{i}(\mathbf{x}) = b_{i} \text{ }i \in [m]$$ for ${f_{i} \in F^{F^{n}}}{i \in [m]}, {b{i} \in F}{i \in [m]}$.

item.title: Matrix Equation Systems are Linear Systems
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $$A \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}$$ be a [[Matrix Equation System]] for $A \in F^{m \times n}, b \in F^{m}$ for $m, n \in \mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Matrix Multiplication is a Linear Function
item.description: [[TODO]] [[Matrix Multiplication]] [[Linear Operator]] [[Field]] [[Vector Space]]

item.title: Matrix Representation of Elementary Row Operations
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $m \in \mathbb{N}$.. All [[Elementary Row Operation]]s of $\text{Row} F^{m \times \cdot}$ can be represented as elements of $F^{m \times m}$.

item.title: Maximum
item.description: Definition A [[Maximal]] element that is unique.

item.title: Maximum Entropy Gaussian Approximations for the Number of Integer Points and Volumes of Polytopes
Maximum Matching
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]] and let $\mathcal{M} = {M \subset E(G) : M \text{ is a Matching}}$. Then a [[Maximum Matching]] is a [[Matching]] $M \in \mathcal{M}$ so that $|M| = \max {|M| \leq |E(G)| : M \in \mathcal{M}}$.

item.title: Maximum Matching Problem
item.description: Definition The [[Maximum Matching Problem]] is an [[Optimization Problem]] that asks, given an [[Undirected Graph]] $G$ to find a [[Maximum Matching]] on $G$.

item.title: Maximums are Non-Decreasing Set Functions
item.description: Statement Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] and suppose $A \subset B \subset T$ such that $\max A$ and $\max B$ both exist.

item.title: Measure
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{M}$ be a [[Sigma Algebra]] on $X$. Then $\mu: \mathcal{M} \to [0, \infty]$ is a [[Measure]] if

item.title: Measure Space
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{M}$ be a [[Sigma Algebra]] on $X$. Let $\mu : \mathcal{M} \to [0, \infty]$ be a [[Measure]] on $X, \mathcal{M}$.

item.title: Measureable Function
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \mathcal{M})$ and $(Y, \mathcal{N})$ be [[Measure Space]]s. Let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. Then $f$ is a [[Measureable Function]] if $$\sigma(f) \subset \mathcal{M}$$

item.title: Measureable Functions form a Vector Space
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]] and let $\mathbb{K} = \mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$. Then $L^{0}(X, \mathbb{K})$ is a [[Vector Space]].

item.title: Measureable Set
item.description: [[TODO]] Properties [[Comparing two Measureable Functions is a Measureable Set]]

item.title: Metric Space
item.description: Definition A [[Metric Space]] is a [[Set]] $M$ equipped with a [[Distance Function]] $d: M \times M \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq0}$. Remarks A [[Metric Space]] is naturally endowed with the [[Metric Topology]] An [[Extended Metric Space]] is a [[Metric Space]] if its [[Extended Distance Function]] is actually a [[Distance Function]]

item.title: Metric Topology
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. The [[Metric Topology]] on $M$ is the [[Topology Generated by a Basis|topology generated by the basis]]

item.title: Metrics are Continuous
item.description: Statement Suppose $(M, d)$ is a [[Metric Space]]. Then $d$ is a [[Continuous Function]] from $M \times M \to \mathbb{R}$ (where $\mathbb{R}$ is endowed with its standard [[Distance Function]] $x,y \mapsto |x - y|$ and $M \times M$ is endowed with the [[Product Metric Space]]).

item.title: Minimal Face
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $P \subset V$ be a [[Convex Polytope]]. A [[Minimal Face]] of $P$ is a [[Convex Polytope Face|face]] of $P$ that does not contain any other [[Proper Face]] of $P$.

item.title: Minimum
item.description: Definition Let $(P, \leq)$ be a [[Partial Ordering]]. Then a [[Minimum]] of $A \subset P$ is any $x \in A$ s.

item.title: Minimum Vertex Cover
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]] and let $\mathcal{C} = {C \subset V(G) : C \text{ is a Vertex Cover}}$.

item.title: Model
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]], let $\mathcal{M}$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure]], and let $T$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Theory]]. We say $\mathcal{M}$ is a [[Model]] of $T$ and write $\mathcal{M} \models T$ if $\mathcal{M} \models \phi$ for all $\phi \in T$.

item.title: Monotone Function
item.description: Definition 1 An [[Order-Preserving Function]] Definition 2 A [[Function]] that is either [[Non-Decreasing Function]] or [[Non-Increasing Function]] Remark This term is [[Overload]]ed.

item.title: Monotone Net
item.description: Definition 1 Let $X$ be a [[Partial Ordering]] and $I$ a [[Nonempty]] [[Directed Partial Ordering]] [[Index Set]]. We call a [[Net]] $(x_{\alpha}){\alpha \in I} \subset X$ a [[Monotone Net]] if $x{\bullet}: I \to X$ is a [[Monotone Function]].

item.title: Monotone Nets Converge to their Supremum
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] with the [[Order Topology]]. Let $(x_{\alpha}){\alpha \in A} \subset X$ be an [[Order-Preserving Net]] on $X$.

item.title: Monotone Sequence
item.description: Definition A [[Sequence]] that is a [[Monotone Function]] (from $\mathbb{N}$ to its [[Codomain]]).

item.title: Monotone Sequences converge to their Extremum
item.description: Statement $(x_{n}) \subset \mathbb{R}$ be a [[Monotone Sequence]]. Let $t \in \bar{\mathbb{R}}$ be it’s [[Extremum]] corresponding to the direction of the monotone sequence ( if [[Non-Increasing Function]] then [[Infimum]]; if [[Non-Decreasing Function]] then [[Supremum]]).

item.title: Musings
item.description: [[Information Space]]

item.title: Mutually Disjoint
item.description: Definition Let ${A_{i}}{i \in I}$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Set]]s [[Index Set|indexed]] by $I$. We say ${A{i}}{i \in I}$ is [[Mutually Disjoint]] if for any $i, j \in I$, $A{i}$ and $A_{j}$ are [[Disjoint Sets]].

item.title: N-tuples over a Field form a Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]]. Then $S = F^{n}$ is a [[Vector Space]]. Proof This follows by recalling that [[Cartesian Product]]s are defined as [[Function]]s, then applying [[Functions to a Field form a Vector Space]].

item.title: Natural Numbers are Well-Ordered
item.description: Statement [[TODO]] Other Outlinks [[Well-Ordering]]

item.title: Neighborhood Basis
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then $\mathcal{B}_{x}$ is a [[Neighborhood Basis]] for $x \in X$ if $B$ is [[Open]] for all $B \in \mathcal{B}_{x}$ $x \in B$ for all $B \in \mathcal{B}_{x}$ If $U$ is [[Open]] and $x \in U$, there exists $B \in \mathcal{B}_{x}$ so that $B \subset U$.

item.title: Neighborhood of a Point
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then a [[Neighborhood of a Point|neighborhood]] of $x \in X$ is any $U \in \tau$ [[Open]] so that $x \in U$.

item.title: Nested Intervals Theorem
item.description: Statement Let $[a_{n}, b_{n}]$ be a [[Sequence]] of [[Closed Interval]]s in $\mathbb{R}$ s.t. $b_{1} \geq b_{2} \geq …$ and $a_{1} \leq a_{2} \leq \cdots$ and $b_{n} - a_{n} \to 0$ as $n \to \infty$.

item.title: Net
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a ([[Nonempty]]) [[Set]] and [[Index Set]] $A$ a [[Nonempty]] [[Directed Partial Ordering]]. Then [[Function]] $x_{\bullet}: A \to X$ is a [[Net]].

item.title: Net Convergence
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and ${x_{\alpha}}{\alpha \in A} \subset X$ be a [[Net]]. We say $x{\bullet}$ [[Net Convergence|converges]] to $x \in X$ if for all [[Open]] $U \subset X$ so $U \ni x$, there exists $\alpha_{0} \in A$ so that for all $\alpha \geq \alpha_{0}$, $x_{\alpha} \in U$.

item.title: Net Limits are unique in Hausdorff Spaces
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be [[Hausdorff]] and let $(x_{\alpha})_{\alpha \in A} \subset X$ be a [[Net]] that [[Net Convergence|converges]] to both $x,y \in X$.

item.title: Non-Decreasing Function
item.description: Definition Let $f: X \to Y$, where $X$ and $Y$ are [[Total Ordering|totally ordered]]. Then $f$ is Non-decreasing if $\forall x, y \in X$:

item.title: Non-Increasing Function
item.description: Definition Let $f: X \to Y$, where $X$ and $Y$ are [[Total Ordering|totally ordered]]. Then $f$ is a [[Non-Increasing Function]] if $\forall x, y \in X$:

item.title: Nondeterministic Polynomial Time Solvable
item.description: [[TODO]] this is known as the [[Complexity Class]] $\mathcal{NP}$.

item.title: Nonempty Compact Sets are Tightly Bounded
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(Y, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] with the [[Order Topology]]. Let $K \subset Y$ be [[Nonempty]] and [[Compact]].

item.title: Nonnegative Bounded Strategy on Submartingale is a Submartingale
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\mathcal{B}$. Let $(X_{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$-[[Submartingale]] on $\Omega, \mathcal{B}$ and let $(H{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Strategy]] for $(X{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$.

item.title: Nonnegative Bounded Strategy on Supermartingale is a Supermartingale
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\mathcal{B}$. Let $(X_{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$-[[Supermartingale]] on $\Omega, \mathcal{B}$ and let $(H{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Strategy]] for $(X{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$.

item.title: Norm
item.description: Definition 1 Let $X$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{K} = \mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$. A [[Norm]] $||\cdot||: X \to \mathbb{R}_{\geq 0}$ is a [[Function]] such that

item.title: Norm Topology
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. The [[Norm Topology]] on $X$ is the [[Metric Topology]] of the [[Norms induce Metrics|metric induced by]] $||\cdot||$

item.title: Normed Vector Space
item.description: Definition A [[Normed Vector Space]] is a [[Vector Space]] $X$ equipped with a [[Norm]] $||\cdot||$.

item.title: Norms are Continuous
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then $||\cdot||$ is a [[Continuous Function]]. Proof Recall $x,y \mapsto ||x - y||$ is the [[Norms induce Metrics|distance function induced by our norm]].

item.title: Open
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then $U \subset X$ is [[Open]] if $U \in \tau$.

item.title: Open Ball
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Metric Space]] and let $x \in M$. Then an [[Open Ball]] about $x$ of radius $\epsilon \in \mathbb{R}{>0}$ is the [[Set]]: $$B{\epsilon}(x) := {y \in M : d(x,y) < \epsilon}.

item.title: Open Cover
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]], $I \preccurlyeq \mathcal{P}(X)$ be an [[Index Set]], and $S \subset X$. An [[Open Cover]] of $S$ is a [[Set|collection]] ${U_\alpha}{\alpha \in I}$ such that $$\bigcup\limits{\alpha \in I}U_{\alpha}\supset S.

item.title: Open Covers in a Second Countable space reduce to a Countable Subcover
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Second Countable]]. Let $S \subset X$ and let $\mathcal{U} := {U_\alpha}_{\alpha \in I}$ be an [[Open Cover]] of $S$.

item.title: Open Halfspace
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$. An [[Open Halfspace]] is a [[Set]] of the form $$H = {x : \langle x, a \rangle > b}$$ for any $a \in V$ and $b \in \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Open Interval
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. An [[Open Interval]] is $(a,b)$ for $a \leq b \in T$ is the [[Set]] $$(a,b) := {x \in T : a < x < b}$$

item.title: Open Map
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $F: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. $F$ is called an [[Open Map]] if for all [[Open]] $U \subset X$, $F(U) \subset Y$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Open Ray
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. An [[Open Ray]] is a [[Set]] $R \subset T$ of the form ${x \in T : x < a}$ or ${x \in T : x > a}$ for some $a \in T$.

item.title: Open Subcover
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]], $I \preccurlyeq \mathcal{P}(X)$ be an [[Index Set]], $S \subset X$, and $\mathcal{U} := {U_\alpha}_{\alpha \in I}$ an [[Open Cover]] of $S$.

item.title: Open Unit Ball
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. Then the [[Open Unit Ball]] is the [[Open Ball]] of radius $1$ about $0 \in X$.

item.title: Optimal Solution of Bounded Linear Program is at Vertex
item.description: Statement Suppose $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}$. Consider the [[Linear Program]] $$\begin{align*} &&\max \mathbf{c}^{T} \mathbf{x}\ &\text{s.

item.title: Optimal Solution Set of Linear Program is a Face of Constraint Polytope
item.description: Statement Suppose for $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}$, we have the [[Linear Program]] $$\begin{align*} &&\max \mathbf{c}^{T} \mathbf{x}\ &\text{s.

item.title: Oracle Government
item.description: Dates: [[2022-04-17]] An [[Oracle Government]] is a [[Governmental System]] such that whenever the citizens face a major problem, they go to an oracle device to get an answer for what they should do.

item.title: Order of an Equation System
item.description: Definition The [[Order of an Equation System|order]] of an [[Equation System]] is the [[Set Cardinality|cardinality]] of its [[Index Set]] $A$.

item.title: Order Relation
item.description: Definition Let $P$ be a [[Set]] and let $R \subset P \times P$ be a [[Relation]] on $P$. Then $R$ is an [[Order Relation]] if $R$ is a [[Preorder Relation]] and the following holds:

item.title: Order Topology
item.description: Definition Let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. Then the [[Order Topology]] on $T$ is the [[Topology Generated by a Set|topology generated by the]] [[Open Ray]]s on $T$.

item.title: Order Topology coincides with Metric Topology on the Real Numbers
item.description: Statement Let $\mathbb{R}$ be viewed as a [[Metric Space]] equipped with the [[Euclidean Distance]] and as a [[Total Ordering]] with its usual [[Order Relation]].

item.title: Order Topology is Hausdorff
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] with the [[Order Topology]]. Then $X$ is [[Hausdorff]]. Proof We break into cases on $X$.

item.title: Order-Preserving Function
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Partial Ordering]]s. Let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. We say $f$ is [[Order-Preserving Function|order-preserving]] if for $x, x’ \in X$, $$x \leq x’ \Rightarrow f(x) \leq f(x’).

item.title: Order-Preserving Net
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Partial Ordering]] and $I$ a [[Nonempty]] [[Directed Partial Ordering]] [[Index Set]]. We call a [[Net]] $(x_{\alpha}){\alpha \in I} \subset X$ an [[Order-Preserving Net]] if $x{\bullet}: I \to X$ is an [[Order-Preserving Function]].

item.title: Order-Reversing Function
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Partial Ordering]]s. Let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. We say $f$ is [[Order-Reversing Function|order-reversing]] if for $x, x’ \in X$, $$x \leq x’ \Rightarrow f(x) \geq f(x’).

item.title: Ordered Abelian Group
item.description: Definition An [[Abelian Group]] that is a [[Left Ordered Group]].

item.title: Ordered Abelian Groups are Bi-Ordered Groups
item.description: Statement Let $(G, \leq)$ be an [[Ordered Abelian Group]]. Then $G$ is a [[Bi-Ordered Group]]. Proof Let $g, h, h’ \in G$ so that $h \leq h’$.

item.title: Ordered Pair
item.description: Definition Let $x, y$ be two [[Set]]s. Then the [[Ordered Pair]] $(x, y)$ is defined as the [[Set]] ${{x}, {x, y}}$.

item.title: Partial Converse of Borel-Cantelli Lemma
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and suppose $({A}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset \mathcal{B}$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Independence|independent events]]. If $$\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} \mathbb{P}(A_{n}) = \infty$$ then $$\mathbb{P}(A_{n} \text{ i.

item.title: Partial Ordering
item.description: Definition Let $P$ be a [[Set]] and let $\leq$ be an [[Order Relation]] on $P$. Then $(P, \leq)$ is a [[Partial Ordering]].

item.title: Partition
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. A [[Partition]] $\mathcal{S} \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$ of $X$ is a collection of [[Mutually Disjoint]] [[Nonempty]] subsets of $X$ that [[Set Cover|cover]] $X$.

item.title: Path Length
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is a [[Directed Graph]] ([[Undirected Graph]]) and $P$ is a [[Graph Path]] on $G$. Then the [[Path Length]] of $P$ is the [[Tuple Order]] of $P$.

item.title: Path-Components Partition the Space
item.description: Statement Suppose $X$ is a [[Topological Space]]. Then the [[Set|collection]] $$\mathcal{P} := {P \subset X : P \text{ is a nonempty path-connected component}}$$ is a [[Partition]] of $X$.

item.title: Path-Connected Component
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $P \subset X$ is a [[Path-Connected Component]] of $X$ if $P$ is a [[Maximal]] (wrt [[Subset Relation]]) [[Path-Connected|path-connected set]].

item.title: Path-Connected Components are equal to the Connected Components in a Locally Path-Connected Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Then the [[Set|collection]] $\mathcal{P} := {P \subset X : P \text{ is a path-component of }X}$ is equal to $\mathcal{C} := {C \subset X : C \text{ is a connected component of }X}$.

item.title: Path-Connected Components are equal to the Connected Components in a Topological Manifold
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Manifold]]. Then the [[Set|collection]] $\mathcal{P} := {P \subset X : P \text{ is a path-component of }X}$ is equal to $\mathcal{C} := {C \subset X : C \text{ is a connected component of }X}$.

item.title: Path-Connected Components of Locally Path-Connected Spaces are Open
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Then every [[Path-Connected Component]] $P \subset X$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Path-Connected Components of Topological Manifolds are Open
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. Then every [[Path-Connected Component]] $C \subset X$ is [[Open]].

item.title: Path-Connected implies Connected
item.description: [[TODO]] - if it is not connected, then two disjoint open subsets. Take point from either and draw a path between them.

item.title: Path-Connectedness is a Topological Invariant
item.description: Statement Suppose $X, Y$ are [[Topological Space]]s and $X \cong Y$. Then $X$ is [[Path-Connected]] [[If and Only If]] $Y$ is.

item.title: Pathwise Connected
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]]. We say that $X$ is [[Path-Connected]] if for every $x, y \in X$, there exists a [[Continuous Function]] $f: [0,1] \to X$ so that $f(0) = x$ and $f(1) = y$

item.title: Perfect Matching
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]] and let $M \subset E(G)$ be a [[Matching]] on $G$. Then $M$ is a [[Perfect Matching]] if ${v \in V(G) : v \text{ is covered by }M} = V(G)$.

item.title: Perfect Matching Problem
item.description: Definition The [[Perfect Matching Problem]] is a [[Decision Problem]] that asks whether a given [[Undirected Graph]] $G$ has a [[Perfect Matching]].

item.title: Pointwise Convergence
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $(Y, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Suppose $(f_{n})$ is a [[Sequence]] of [[Function]]s from $X$ to $Y$.

item.title: Positive Semidefinite Matrices form a Convex Cone
item.description: Statement Suppose $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then $\mathbb{S}_{n}^{+}$ is a [[Convex Cone]] over $\mathbb{R}$. Proof Suppose $X, Y \in \mathbb{S}_{n}^{+}$ and $a, b \geq 0$.

item.title: Positive Semidefinite Matrix
item.description: Definition Suppose $A \in \mathbb{R}^{n \times n}$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$ and that $\forall x \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $$x^{T} A x \geq 0$$.

item.title: Precompact
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $S \subset X$ is [[Precompact]] if $\text{cl}S$ is [[Compact]].

item.title: Predictable Process
item.description: Definition Suppose $(U_{n})$ is an [[Discrete-Time Process|discrete-time]] [[Adapted Process]] wrt [[Filtration]] $(\mathcal{B}{n})$. Then $(U{n})$ is a [[Predictable Sequence]] if $U_{n}$ is $\mathcal{B}_{n-1}$-[[Measureable Function|measureable]].

item.title: Preorder
item.description: Definition Let $P$ be a [[Set]] and let $R$ be a [[Preorder Relation]] on $P$. Then $(P, R)$ is a [[Preorder]].

item.title: Preorder Relation
item.description: Definition Let $P$ be a [[Set]] and let $R \subset P \times P$ be a [[Relation]] on $P$. Then $R$ is a [[Preorder Relation]] if

item.title: Probability Distribution Function
item.description: Definition Suppose $F$ is a [[Distribution Function]]. Then we call it a Probability Distribution Function if $$\begin{align*} &F(\infty) = 1\ &F(-\infty) = 0\ \end{align*}$$ We may also call $F$ a

item.title: Product Metric Space
item.description: Definition Let $(M_{i}, d_{i}){i \in I}$ be [[Metric Space]]s with [[Index Set]] $I$ and let $M = \prod\limits{i \in I}^{} M_{i}$.

item.title: Product of Finitely Many Proper Open Sets form a Basis for the Product Topology

item.title: Product of Topological Manifolds is a Manifold
item.description: Statement Let $M_{1}, \dots, M_{k}$ be [[Topological Manifold]]s of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n_{1}, \dots, n_{k}$. Then the [[Product Topological Space]] $M_{1} \times \cdots \times M_{k}$ is a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n_{1} + \cdots + n_{k}$.

item.title: Product Sigma Algebra
item.description: Definition Let $(X_{\alpha}, \mathcal{M}\alpha){\alpha \in I}$ be a [[Set|family]] of [[Measure Space]]s indexed by [[Index Set]] $I$. The [[Product Sigma Algebra]] on $\prod\limits_{\alpha \in I} X_{\alpha}$ is defined as $$\bigotimes\limits_{\alpha \in I} \mathcal{M}{\alpha} = \sigma ({\pi{\alpha}^{-1}(E_\alpha): \forall \alpha \in I, \forall E_{\alpha}\in \mathcal{M}\alpha})$$ where $\pi{\alpha} : \prod\limits_{\beta \in I} X_{\beta} \to X_\alpha$ is the $\alpha$-[[Projection Map]].

item.title: Product Topological Space
item.description: Definition Let $I$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Index Set]] and let ${X_{i}}{i \in I}$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Topological Space]]s. Then the [[Product Topological Space]] on $\prod\limits{i \in I} X_{i}$ is the [[Topology Generated by a Set|topology generated by the set]] $$\mathcal{B} := {\pi_{i}^{-1}(U_{i}) : U_{i} \subset X_{i} \text{ is open}, i \in I}$$ where $\pi_{i}$ is the [[Projection Map]] $X \to X_{i}$ defined as $x \mapsto x_{i}$.

item.title: Proper Face
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be an [[Inner Product Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $P \subset V$ be a [[Convex Polytope]]. A [[Proper Face]] of $P$ is a [[Convex Polytope Face|face]] of $P$ that is not $P$ or $\emptyset$.

item.title: Pseudo-Boolean Function
item.description: Definition A [[Pseudo-Boolean Function]] is a [[Function]] of the form $f: {0, 1}^{n} \to \mathbb{R}$ for some $n \in \mathbb{N}$

item.title: Pseudo-Norm
item.description: A [[Norm]] but only satisfies [[Homogeniety]] and [[Triangle Inequality]]

item.title: Quotient Map is a Contraction Operator
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Banach Space]] and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Closed]] [[Vector Subspace]]. Then the [[Quotient Map]] $J : X \to X / Y$ defined as $J(x) := [x]$ is a [[Bounded Linear Operator]] and $||J|| \leq 1$.

item.title: Quotient Norm
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]] and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Closed]] [[Vector Subspace]]. Then $||[\cdot]|| : X / Y \to \mathbb{R}{\geq 0}$ defined as $$||[x]|| := \inf\limits{y \in Y} ||x - y|| = \text{dist}{x, Y}$$ for $x \in X$ is a [[Norm]] on $X / Y$.

item.title: Quotient Normed Space of a Banach Space is Banach
item.description: Statement Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Banach Space]] and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Closed]] [[Vector Subspace]]. Then the [[Quotient Normed Vector Space]] $(X / Y, ||[\cdot]||)$ is a [[Banach Space]].

item.title: Quotient Normed Vector Space
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]] and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Closed]] [[Vector Subspace]]. Then we call the [[Quotient Vector Space]] $X / Y$ endowed with the [[Quotient Norm]] $||[\cdot]||$ [[Quotient Normed Vector Space]].

item.title: Quotient Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$ and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Vector Subspace]]. Denote $X / Y$ to be the [[Equivalence Class]]es of the [[Equivalence Relation]] $\sim$ where $x \sim x$ if $x-x’ \in Y$ for $x,x’ \in X$.

item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. The [[Random Bayes Classifier]] is a [[Random Classifier]] $F$ so that for $x \in \mathcal{D}$

item.title: Random Classifier
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Let $f: \mathcal{D} \to \mathcal{P}^{n}$. Then a [[Random Classifier]] is a [[Random Variable]] $F$ on $[n]$ s.

item.title: Random Variable
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. A [[Random Variable]] is a [[Borel Measureable Function]] $X: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Rationals are Dense in the Reals
item.description: Statement 1 $\mathbb{Q}$ is a [[Dense]] subset of $\mathbb{R}$. Proof 1 Recalling the [[Sequence Completion Construction of the Reals]], every $x \in \mathbb{R}$ is defined as a an [[Equivalence Relation]] over [[Cauchy Sequence]]s in $\mathbb{Q}$, where elements of $\mathbb{Q}$ are identified with constant sequences.

item.title: Regular Conditional Probability
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Then a [[Regular Conditional Probability]] on $(\Omega, \mathcal{B})$ is a [[Regular Conditional Distribution]] for $\text{id}_{\Omega}$.

item.title: Reverse Ordering
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(P, \leq)$ be a [[Partial Ordering]]. Then the [[Reverse Ordering]] of $P$, $(P, \leq’)$ is defined as $a \leq’ b \Leftrightarrow a \geq b$ $\forall a,b \in T$.

item.title: Reverse Ordering generates same Topology
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] with the [[Order Topology]]. Let $\leq’$ be the [[Reverse Ordering]] on $X$. Then $(X, \leq’)$ has the same [[Order Topology]] as $(X, \leq)$.

item.title: Right Continuous Inverse
item.description: Definition Let $F: \mathbb{R} \to \mathbb{R}$ be a [[Distribution Function]]. The [[Right Continuous Inverse]] of $F$ is defined $$F^{\rightarrow}(x) = \inf {s \in \mathbb{R} : F(s) > x}$$

item.title: Row Equivalent Matrix Systems
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]]. Let $m, n \in \mathbb{N}$, let $A, B \in F^{m \times n}$, and let $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in F^{m \times 1}$.

item.title: Row Equivalent Matrix Systems have the same Solution Set
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]], let $m,n \in \mathbb{N}$ and let $A \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{b}$ and $B \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{c}$ be two [[Row Equivalent Matrix Systems]]s.

item.title: Row Reduced Echelon Matrix
item.description: Definition 1 Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $m, n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then $R \in F^{m \times n}$ is a [[Row Reduced Echelon Matrix]] if

item.title: Row Reduced Matrix
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $m, n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then we say $R \in F^{m \times n}$ is a [[Row Reduced Matrix]] if

item.title: Satisfaction Relation
item.description: Definition 1 Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]], let $\mathcal{M}$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]], let $\phi$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Formula|formula]], and let $\sigma$ be an [[Assignment]] to $\mathcal{M}$.

item.title: Satisfiable Theory
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $T$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Theory]]. We say $T$ is a [[Satisfiable Theory]] if there is an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure]] $\mathcal{M}$ such that $\mathcal{M} \models T$.

item.title: Scalar product with -1 is additive inverse in vector spaces
item.description: Statement Suppose $v \in V$. Then $-1 v = -v$. Proof $$\begin{align*} v + (-1) v &= 1 v + (-1) v\ &=(1 - 1)v\ &= 0 v\ & \mathbf{0}, \end{align*}$$

item.title: Scheffe's Lemma
item.description: Statement Let $F_{1}, F_{2}$ be two [[Probability Distribution Function]]s and suppose they have [[Probability Density Function|density]] [[function]]s $f_{1}, f_{2}$ with respect to [[Measure]] $\mu$ on $\mathcal{B}( \mathbb{R})$.

item.title: Second Countable Space
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. We say $X$ is [[Second Countable]] if there exists a [[Countable]] [[Topological Basis]] for $X$.

item.title: Semidefinite Program
item.description: Definition [[TODO]] %%Suppose $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}$. Then the [[Constrained Optimization Program]]

item.title: Sentence
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. An $\mathcal{L}$-[[Formula]] $\phi$ is an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Sentence]] if it has no [[Free Variable]]s.

item.title: Sentence Satisfaction under one Assignment means Satisfaction under all Assignments
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $\phi$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Sentence]]. Let $\mathcal{M}$ be an $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]] Then [[The following are Equivalent]]:

item.title: Separable Space
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $X$ is a [[Separable Space]] if there exists $S \subset X$ so that $S$ is [[Countable]] and $S$ is [[Dense]] in $X$.

item.title: Sequence
item.description: Definition A [[Function]] $f: \mathbb{N} \to X$ for some [[Set]] $X$. It is usually denoted ${x_n}{n=1}^{\infty} \subset X$ or $(x{n}) \subset X$, and if $n \in \mathbb{N}$ is known, we write $x_{n}$ as shorthand for $f(n)$.

item.title: Sequence Convergence
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $(x_n) \subset X$. We say $x_{n}$ converges to $x \in X$ if $\forall V \in \tau$ so that $x \in V$, there exists $N \in \mathbb{N}$ so that $x_{n} \in V$ $\forall n \geq N$.

item.title: Sequence Limits are unique in Hausdorff Spaces
item.description: Statement Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Hausdorff]]. Let $(x_n) \subset X$. Then if $x_{n} \to x \in X$ and $x_{n} \to y \in Y$, $x=y$.

item.title: Sequential Limits are Limit Points of the Sequence
item.description: Definition Suppose $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]] and let $(x_n) \subset X$. Suppose $x_{n} \to x \in X$. Then $x$ is a [[Limit Point]] of ${x_{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Series
item.description: Definition Let $(G, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] so that $(G, +)$ is an [[Abelian Group]]. Suppose $({x}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset {G}$. Denote the partial sums $p_{n} := \sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} x_{i}$.

item.title: Series Convergence
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be a [[Topological Space]] and an [[Abelian Group]] and let $({a}{n}){n=1}^{\infty} \subset {G}$ be a [[Sequence]]. Then we say $\sum\limits_{n=1}^{\infty} a_{n}$ [[Series Convergence|converges]] if $(\sum\limits_{i=1}^{n} a_{i})_{n=1}^{\infty}$ [[Series Convergence|converges]] in $G$.

item.title: Service
item.description: I enjoy finding ways to share what I like about math, computer science, and machine learning with others. Rice University (Aug 2018 May 2019) CS I/O Committee Director I was the first director of an undergraduate committee that voices student opinion to the Rice CS Dept.

item.title: Set Cover
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{S}$ be a [[Set|collection]] of subsets of $X$. Then $\mathcal{S}$ is a [[Set Cover]] of $X$ if $\bigcup\limits \mathcal{S} = X$.

item.title: Set Distance
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] and suppose $A, B \subset M$. Then we say the [[Set Distance]] between $A$ and $B$, denoted $\text{dist}{A, B}$, is $$\text{dist}{A, B} := \inf\limits_{x \in A, y \in B} d(x, y).

item.title: Set Intersection
item.description: [[TODO]] [[Axiom Schema of Replacement]] Remarks Often, in constructions, we talk about the “smallest” such [[Set]] which satisfies some properties.

item.title: Set Union
item.description: Definition 1 Let $A$, $B$ be [[Set]]s. Then $A \cup B := {x : x \in A \vee x \in B}$.

item.title: Shannon Entropy is a Concave Function
item.description: [[Shannon Entropy]] is a [[Concave Function]]

item.title: Short Homogenous Matrix Systems have nontrivial solutions
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $m < n \in \mathbb{N}$. Suppose $A \in F^{m \times n}$ defines the [[Homogenous Linear System|homogenous]] [[Matrix Equation System]] $$A \mathbf{x} = \mathbf{0}$$ Then there exists $\mathbf{x} \neq \mathbf{0}$ in the [[Solution Set]].

item.title: Sigma Algebra
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Set]]. Then $\mathcal{M} \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$ is a [[Sigma Algebra]] on $X$ if $X \in \mathcal{M}$ If $A \in \mathcal{M}$ then $A^{C} \in \mathcal{M}$ Suppose $(A_n){n \in \mathbb{N}} \subset \mathcal{M}$.

item.title: Sigma Algebra induced by an Indicator Function
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Let $A \in \mathcal{P}(X)$. Then $$\sigma(1_{A}) = {\emptyset, A, A^{C}, X}$$ Proof We must check that $$\sigma(1_{A}) = {1_{A}^{-1}(E) : E \in \mathcal{B}(\mathbb{R}) } = {\emptyset, A, A^{C}, X}$$

item.title: Sigma Algebra induced by Function
item.description: Definition Let $X$ and $(Y, \mathcal{N})$ be [[Measure Space]]s. Let $f: X \to Y$ be a [[Function]]. Then the [[Sigma Algebra induced by Function|sigma algebra induced by]] $f$ is $$\sigma(f) := {f^{-1}(E) : E \in \mathcal{N}}$$

item.title: Sigma Algebra induced by Random Variable
item.description: [[Sigma Algebra induced by Function]]

item.title: Sigma Algebra produced by a Function
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{M})$ be a [[Measure Space]], $Y$ a [[Set]] and $f : X \to Y$ a [[Function]]. Then $$\sigma^{*}(f) = {E \subset Y : f^{-1}(E) \in \mathcal{M}}$$ is a [[Sigma Algebra]].

item.title: Sigma Field up to Constant Stopping Time is just the Sigma Field at that time
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{F} = {\mathcal{B}{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] over $\Omega$, let $k \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$, and let $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ be the [[Stopping Time]] on $\mathcal{F}$ defined as $\nu(\omega) = k$.

item.title: Sigma Field up to Stopping Time
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{F} = {\mathcal{B}{n} : n \in \mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] over $\Omega$ and let $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ be a [[Stopping Time]] on $\mathcal{F}$.

item.title: Sigma-Finite Measure
item.description: Definition Let $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ be a [[Measure Space]]. We call $\mu$ a [[Sigma-Finite Measure]] if there exists a [[Countable]] [[Partition]] of $X$, ${P_{n}}{n \in \mathbb{N}}$, so that $\mu(P{n}) < \infty$ for all $n \in \mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Simple Function
item.description: Definition Let $\phi : X \to \mathbb{C}^{n}$ be a [[Function]] for some [[Set]] $X$ and $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Then $\phi$ is a [[Simple Function]] if $\phi(X)$ is a [[Finite Set]].

item.title: Simple Path
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is a [[Directed Graph]] ([[Undirected Graph]]) and suppose $P$ is a [[Graph Path|path]] on $G$ with [[Path Length]] $|P| = n$.

item.title: Slices of a Continuous Function are Continuous
item.description: Statement Let $X,Y,Z$ be [[Topological Space]]s and suppose $F: X \times Y \to Z$ is a [[Continuous Function]]. Then $F_{x}$, is a [[Continuous Function]].

item.title: Smoothing
item.description: Statement 1 Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $X$ be a [[Random Variable]] on $\Omega$. Suppose $\mathcal{G}{1} \subset \mathcal{G}{2} \subset \mathcal{B}$ are sub-[[Sigma Algebra]]s on $\Omega$.

item.title: Snap
item.description: See https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Snap_(software) https://www.tecmint.com/install-snap-in-linux/ Useful Workflows [[Install a .snap file]] Other Outlinks [[Linux]]

item.title: Soft Classifier
item.description: Definition Let $(X, Y, n)$ be a [[Classification Problem]]. Then $g: \mathcal{D} \to [0,1]^{n}$ is a [[Soft Classifier]] if $\forall x \in \mathcal{D}$, $g(x)$ is a valid [[Probability Measure|Distribution]] on $[n]$.

item.title: Solution Set
item.description: Definition Let $S, R$ be a [[Set]]s, and let ${f_{\alpha}\in R^{S}}{\alpha \in A}$ and ${b{\alpha} \in R}{\alpha \in A}$ define an [[Equation System]] $$f{\alpha}(x)= b_{\alpha} \text{ }\forall \alpha \in A$$ for some [[Index Set]] $A$.

item.title: Solution set of Linear Equations is an Affine Set
item.description: Statement Let $V, W$ be a [[Vector Space]]s over $\mathbb{R}$, let $T \in \mathcal{L}(V, W)$, and let $b \in W$ define the [[Linear Equation System]] $$T(x) = b.

item.title: Space of Polynomials over a Field form a Vector Subspace of Function Vector Space
item.description: Statement Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and denote $$P[F] = {x \mapsto \sum\limits_{k=0}^{n} c_{k}x^{k} : n \in \mathbb{Z}{\geq 0}; c{0}, \dots, c_{n} \in F }$$ the [[Set]] of all [[Polynomial]]s over $F$.

item.title: Span is Monotonic
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] and let $S \subset R \subset V$. Then $\text{span}S \subset \text{span}R$. Proof Observe $$\text{span} R = \bigcap\limits{W \subset V : R \subset W, W \text{ is a subspace of V}} \supset R \supset S,$$ so by [[The Span of subset of a Span is also a subset of that Span]], we have that $\text{span} S \subset \text{span} R$.

item.title: Spanning Set
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. We call $S \subset V$ a [[Spanning Set]] of $V$ if $\text{span} S = V$.

item.title: Spanning Set Size bound Linearly Independent Set Size
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$ that is [[Spanning Set|spanned by]] $R \subset V$ and denote $|R| = \infty \in \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ if $R$ is an [[Infinite Set]].

item.title: Sphere
item.description: Definition Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. The [[Sphere]] about $x \in M$ of radius $\epsilon > 0$ is $$S_{\epsilon}(x) := {x’ \in X : d(x, x’) = \epsilon}$$

item.title: Sphere is Closed
item.description: Statement Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]]. Let $x \in M$ and $\epsilon > 0$. Then $S_\epsilon(x)$ is [[Closed]].

item.title: Standard Basis
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]] and let $n \in \mathbb{N}$. Denote $\epsilon_{i} = (0, \dots, 0, 1, 0, \dots, 0) \in F^{n}$ to be the element of all $0$’s except for a $1$ in the $i$th position for some $i \in [n]$.

item.title: Standard Borel Space
item.description: [[TODO]] [[Polish Space]] [[Borel Measure Space]]

item.title: Standard Gaussian Random Variable
item.description: Definition Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]]. If $X \sim \mathcal{N}(0, 1)$, then $X$ is a [[Standard Gaussian Random Variable]].

item.title: Standard Probability Space
item.description: [[TODO]] [[Standard Borel Space]] [[Characterization of Standard Borel Spaces]]

item.title: State Space
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]], and let $(S, \Sigma)$ be a [[Measure Space]].

item.title: Stochastic Process
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]], and let $(S, \Sigma)$ be a [[Measure Space]].

item.title: Stock
item.description: Definition A [[Stock]] is a [[Security]] that represents fractional ownership of a [[Corporation]]. Units of [[Stock]] are called [[Share]]s. Ownership A [[Share]] of a [[Stock]] represents fractional ownership of a [[Corporation]], determined by the number of [[Outstanding Share]]s.

item.title: Stopping Time
item.description: Definition Suppose ${\mathcal{B}{n} : n \in \mathbb{N} }$ is a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\Omega$. Then a [[Function]] $\nu : \Omega \to \bar{\mathbb{N}}$ is a [[Stopping Time]] if $$[\nu = n] \in \mathcal{B}{n}, \forall n \in \mathbb{N}$$

item.title: Strategy
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\mathcal{B}$. Let $(H_{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a [[Predictable Sequence]] on $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ and let $(X{n}){n=1}^{\infty}$ be a $\mathcal{F}{n}$-[[Adapted Process]] $\Omega, \mathcal{B}$.

item.title: Strategy Corresponding to a Stopping Time
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] on $\mathcal{B}$. Let $\nu$ be a [[Stopping Time]] on $(\mathcal{F}{n}){n=0}^{\infty}$.

item.title: Strictly Convex Function
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$, let $S \subset V$ be a [[Convex Set]], and suppose $f: S \to \mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Stronger Norm
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Subspace]] and let $Y \subset X$ be a [[Vector Subspace]] equipped with [[Norm]] $|||\cdot|||$.

item.title: Sub-Sigma Algebra
item.description: Definition A [[Sub-Sigma Algebra]] is a subset of a [[Sigma Algebra]] that is also a [[Sigma Algebra]].

item.title: Subgraph
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be a [[Directed Graph]] ([[Undirected Graph]]). Then $G’$ is a [[Subgraph]] of $G$ if $V(G’) \subset V(G)$ and $E(G’) \subset E(G)$.

item.title: Submartingale
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $X: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}^{T}$ be an [[Adapted Process]] wrt [[Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{B}{t})_{t \in T}$ on $\Omega$.

item.title: Subnet
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let ${x_{\alpha}}{\alpha \in A} \subset X$ be a [[Net]]. We say a [[Net]] ${y{\beta}}{\beta \in B} \subset X$ is a [[Subnet]] of ${x{\alpha}}_{\alpha \in A}$ if $\exists n: B \to A$ s.

item.title: Subsequence
item.description: Definition Let $f: \mathbb{N} \to X$ be a [[Sequence]] on $X$. Let $g: \mathbb{N} \to \mathbb{N}$ be an [[Increasing]] [[Function]]. Then $g \circ f$ is a [[Subsequence]] of $f$.

item.title: Subset of a Precompact Set is Precompact
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$ be [[Precompact]]. Then if $R \subset S$, $R$ is [[Precompact]] as well.

item.title: Subset of Linearly Independent Set is Linearly Independent
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] and let $S \subset V$ be [[Linearly Independent]]. Then for all $R \subset S$, $R$ is [[Linearly Independent]].

item.title: Subset Relation
item.description: Definition 1 We say $A \subset B$ if $\forall t (t \in A \Rightarrow t \in B)$. Definition 2 Let $S$ be a [[Set]].

item.title: Subspace associated with an Affine Set
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{R}$ and let $S \subset V$ be an [[Affine Set]]. Suppose $u \in S$.

item.title: Subspace Span
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$. Let $S \subset V$. The [[Subspace Span]] of $S$ is $$\text{span} S = \bigcap\limits{W \subset V : S \subset W, W \text{ is a subspace of V}}$$ $\blacksquare$

item.title: Subspace Topology
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \tau)$ be a [[Topological Space]] and let $S \subset X$. Then $(S, \tau \cap S)$, where $\tau \cap S := {U \cap S \subset X : U \in \tau}$, is a [[Topological Space]] on $S$.

item.title: Subspace Topology preserves Bases
item.description: Statement

item.title: Sum of Independent Random Variables is in L1 if and only if Random Variables are in L1
item.description: Statement Suppose $(\Omega, \mathcal{M}, \mathbb{P})$ is a [[Probability Space]] and $X, Y$ are [[Independence|independent]] [[Random Variable]]s on $\Omega$. Then $X+Y \in L^{1}(\Omega)$ [[If and Only If]] $X, Y \in L^{1}(\Omega)$.

item.title: Sum of Supremum bounds Supremum of Sum
item.description: Statement 1 Suppose $X$ is a [[Set]] and $(Y, \leq)$ is a [[Bi-Ordered Group]]. Suppose $f: X \to Y$ and $g: X \to Y$.

item.title: Supermartingale
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $X: \Omega \to \mathbb{R}^{T}$ be an [[Adapted Process]] wrt [[Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{B}{t})_{t \in T}$ on $\Omega$.

item.title: Superset of Linearly Dependent Set is Linearly Dependent
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] and let $S \subset V$ be [[Linearly Dependent]]. Then for all $R \supset S$, $R$ is [[Linearly Dependent]].

item.title: Support of a Measure
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(X, \mathcal{B}(X), \mu)$ be a [[Borel Measure Space]] with [[Borel Measure]] $\mu$. The [[Support of a Measure|support]] of $\mu$, denoted $\text{supp} (\mu)$, is defined $$\text{supp}(\mu) = {x \in X : \forall N_{x} \in \mathcal{N}{x}, \mu(N{x}) > 0}$$ where $\mathcal{N}_{x}$ denotes the [[Set|collection]] of all [[Open]] sets containing $x$.

item.title: Support of a Measure is Closed
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \mathcal{B}(X), \mu)$ be a [[Borel Measure Space]] with [[Borel Measure]] $\mu$. Then $\text{supp}(\mu)$ is [[Closed]]. Proof Recall that [[Complement of Support of Measure is Union of all Null Open Sets]] and is thus [[Open]] by definition of [[Topological Space]].

item.title: Support of a Measureable Function
item.description: Definition [[TODO]] - [[Support of a Measure]] of [[Induced Measure]] of $f$.

item.title: Support of a Random Element
item.description: Definition 1 [[Discrete Support of a Random Element]] Definition 2 [[Continuous Support of a Random Variable]] [[TODO]] - [[Support of a Measureable Function]]

item.title: Supremum
item.description: Definition Let $(T \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]]. Let $A \subset T$. Set $U = {x \in T : x \geq a \text{ } \forall a \in A}$.

item.title: Supremum is in the Closure of a Nonempty Set
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] endowed with the [[Order Topology]]. Suppose $A \subset X$ is [[Nonempty]] and $\sup\limits A \in X$.

item.title: Supremum Metric
item.description: Statement Let $(M_{i}, d_{i}){i \in I}$ be [[Metric Space]]s with [[Index Set]] $I$ and let $M = \prod\limits{i \in I}^{} M_{i}$.

item.title: Supremum Norm
item.description: Statement Let $(X_{i}, ||\cdot||{i}){i \in I}$ be [[Normed Vector Space]]s over [[Field]] $\mathbb{K} = \mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$ with [[Index Set]] $I$ and let $X = \prod\limits_{i \in I}^{} X_{i}$.

item.title: Supremum of a Cofinal Subset is the Supremum of the Set
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]] and let $A \subset X$. Let $S \subset A$ be a [[Cofinal Subset]].

item.title: Supremum of an Increasing Function is Function of Supremum
item.description: Statement Let $(X, \leq)$, $(Y, \leq)$ be [[Total Ordering]]s equipped with their respective [[Order Topology]]s and let $f: T \to S$ be a [[Continuous Function|continuous]] [[Non-Decreasing Function]].

item.title: Supremum of Negative is Negative of Infimum
item.description: Statement Let $A \subset \bar{\mathbb{R}}$. Denote $-A = {-a : a \in A}$. Then $$\sup(-A) = -\inf A$$ Proof [[TODO]]

item.title: Surjection
item.description: Definition Let $X$, $Y$ be [[Set]]s. Then a [[Function]] $f: X \to Y$ is a [[Surjection]] if $f(X) = Y$. That is, for each $y \in Y$, there exists $x \in X$ so that $f(x) = y$.

item.title: Symbol
item.description: Definition A fundamental [[Object]] in [[Mathematics]]. It can be taken to be, quite literally, a single character.

item.title: Symmetric Matrix
item.description: Definition Suppose $n \in \mathbb{N}$ and $A \in F^{n \times n}$ for some [[Field]] $F$. Then we say $A$ is a [[Symmetric Matrix]] if $A^{T} = A$

item.title: Taylor's Theorem
item.description: [[TODO]]

item.title: Term
item.description: Definition The [[Set]] $\mathcal{T}$ of $\mathcal{L}$-[[Term]]s is the [[Set Intersection|smallest set]] such that the following properties hold: $c \in \mathcal{T}$ for each $c \in \mathcal{C}$ ${v_{i} : i \in \mathbb{N}} \subset \mathcal{T}$, where each $v_{i}$ is a distinct [[Variable Symbol]] for each $i \in \mathbb{N}$.

item.title: Term Evaluation
item.description: See remark (1) of [[Assignment]]

item.title: Terms are Finite
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $\mathcal{T}$ be the [[Set]] of $\mathcal{L}$-[[Term]]s. Each $t \in \mathcal{T}$ is a [[Finite Set|Finite]] [[String]].

item.title: The Closed Unit Ball of a Normed Vector Space is Compact iff the Dimension is Finite
item.description: [[TODO]]

item.title: The Empty Set is Linearly Independent
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $\emptyset \subset V$ is [[Linearly Independent]]. Proof Vacuously, there is no [[Finite Set|finite]] subset of $\emptyset$ so that there exists a nontrivial [[Linear Combination]] that equals $\mathbf{0}$.

item.title: The Feasible Set of a Linear Program is a Convex Polytope
item.description: Statement Suppose $n, m \in \mathbb{N}$, $\mathbf{b}, \mathbf{c} \in \mathbb{R}^{n}$, $A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n}$ define the [[Linear Program]] $$\begin{align*} &&\max \mathbf{c}^{T} \mathbf{x}\ &\text{s.

item.title: The Formula Set is the Union of Formula Sets of all Complexities
item.description: [[TODO]]: proof is almost identical to [[The Term Set is the Union of Term Sets of all Complexities]]

item.title: The Induced Sigma Algebra of a Borel Function is Finite iff it is Simple
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Suppose $f: X \to \mathbb{R}$. Then $\sigma(f)$ with respect to $\mathcal{B}(\mathbb{R})$ is a [[Finite Set]] [[If and Only If]] $f$ is a [[Simple Function]].

item.title: The inverse in a Group is unique
item.description: Statement Suppose $G$ is a [[Group]] and $u, v, w \in G$ so that $v$, $w$ are both [[Additive Inverse]]s of $u$.

item.title: The Lp Space of a Separable Measure Space is Separable
item.description: [[TODO]] - StackExchange question

item.title: The Order Topology on a Subset is the Subset Topology
item.description: Statement [[TODO]]

item.title: The Restriction of Homeomorphism is a Homeomorphism in the Subspace Topology
item.description: [[TODO]]

item.title: The Span of subset of a Span is also a subset of that Span
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] and let $S, R \subset V$ so that $\text{span} R \supset S$. Then $\text{span} R \supset \text{span} S$.

item.title: The Subspace Span is the Set of all Linear Combinations
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] on [[Field]] $F$. Let $S \subset V$. Then $${c_{1} \mathbf{x}{1} + \cdots + c{n} \mathbf{x}{n} \in V : n \in \mathbb{Z}{\geq 0}; \mathbf{x}{1}, \dots, \mathbf{x}{n} \in S; c_{1}, \dots, c_{n} \in F} = \text{span} S$$

item.title: The Term Set is the Union of Term Sets of all Complexities
item.description: Statement Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]] and let $\mathcal{T}$ be the [[Set]] of $\mathcal{L}$-[[Term]]s. Let $\mathcal{T}{0} := \mathcal{C} \cup {v{i} : i \in \mathbb{N}}$ and inductively define $$\mathcal{T}{n+1} := \mathcal{T}{n} \cup {f(t_{1}, \dots, t_{n_{f}}) : t_{1}, \dots \in \mathcal{T}{n}, f \in \mathcal{F}}$$ We refer to $\mathcal{T}{n}$ as the [[Term]] set of [[Logical Complexity]] $n$.

item.title: The Topology Generated by a Set has a Basis of Finite Intersections
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $\mathcal{S} \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$. Let $$\mathcal{S}’ := {\bigcap\limits_{i=1}^{n} S_{i} \subset X : S_{i} \in \mathcal{S}, i \in [n], n \in \mathbb{Z}{\geq 0}}$$ and $$\mathcal{S}’’ := {\bigcup\limits{U \in \mathcal{U}}U \subset X : \mathcal{U} \subset \mathcal{S}’}$$ Then $$\tau(\mathcal{S}) = \mathcal{S}’’$$ That is, $\mathcal{S}’$ is a [[Topological Basis]] for $\tau(\mathcal{S})$.

item.title: Theory
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. An $\mathcal{L}$-[[Theory]] is a [[Set]] of $\mathcal{L}$-[[Sentence]]s.

item.title: There is a measure that is absolutely continuous wrt another nontrivial measure, but not sigma-finite
item.description: Statement Consider [[Measure Space]] $(X, \mathcal{M}, \mu)$ so that $\mu(X) > 0$. Consider $\nu: \mathcal{M} \to [0, \infty]$ defined as $$\nu(S) = \begin{cases} 0 &\text{if }\mu(S) = 0 \ \infty &\text{ otherwise} \end{cases}.

item.title: Tightly Bounded Set
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(M, d)$ be a [[Metric Space]] and let $A \subset M$. We say $A$ is a [[Tightly Bounded Set]] if$\sup\limits_{x,y \in A} d(x,y) < \infty$ and there exist $x’,y’ \in A$ s.

item.title: Topological Basis
item.description: Definition Let $X, \tau$ be a [[Topological Space]]. Then $\mathcal{B} \subset \tau$ is a [[Topological Basis]] for $X$ if $$\tau = {\bigcup\limits_{B \in \mathcal{C}} B : \mathcal{C} \subset \mathcal{B}}$$

item.title: Topological Embedding
item.description: Definition Let $X, Y$ be [[Topological Space]]s and let $f: X \to Y$. $f$ is a [[Topological Embedding]] into $Y$ if $f: X \to f(X)$ is a [[Homeomorphism]], where $f(X)$ is given the [[Subspace Topology]] in $Y$.

item.title: Topological Field
item.description: Definition Let $F$ be a [[Field]] that is also a [[Topological Space]]. Then $F$ is a [[Topological Field]] if the operations $+: F \times F \to F$, $*: F \times F \to F$, $x \mapsto -x$, and $x \mapsto x^{-1}$ are all [[Continuous Function|continuous]].

item.title: Topological Invariance of Dimension
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Nonempty]] [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$ and let $N$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $m$.

item.title: Topological Manifolds are Locally Path-Connected
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. $M$ is [[Locally Path-Connected]]. Proof Consider a [[Coordinate Ball]] $B \subset M$.

item.title: Topological Manifolds Connected iff Path-Connected
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. $M$ is [[Connected]] [[If and Only If]] it is [[Path-Connected]].

item.title: Topological Manifolds have Countably many Connected Components
item.description: Statement Let $M$ be a [[Topological Manifold]] of [[Manifold Dimension]] $n$. $M$ has [[Countable|countably]] many [[Connected Component]]s. Proof Because [[Topological Manifolds are Locally Path-Connected]] [[Connected Components of Locally Path-Connected Spaces are Open]] [[Connected Components Partition the Space]] we have that our [[Connected Component]]s form an [[Open Cover]] of $M$, which we denote as $\mathcal{C}$.

item.title: Topological Space
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and $\tau \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$. Then $(X, \tau)$ is a [[Topological Space]] if $X, \emptyset \in \tau$.

item.title: Topological Vector Space
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]] that is also a [[Vector Space]] over [[Topological Field]] $F$. Then $X$ is a [[Topological Vector Space]] if $+ : X \times X \to X$ and $*: F \times X$ are both [[Continuous Function|continuous]].

item.title: Topology Generated by a Basis
item.description: Statement Let $X$ be a [[Set]]. Let $\mathcal{B} \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$ be such that: $\forall x \in X$ there exists $B \in \mathcal{B}$ so that $x \in B$.

item.title: Topology Generated by a Set
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Set]] and let $B \subset \mathcal{P}(X)$. Then we define $\tau(B)$, the [[Topology Generated by a Set]] as $$\tau(B) := \bigcap\limits {\tau \subset \mathcal{P}(X) : B \subset \tau, \tau \text{ is a topology on }X}.

item.title: Total Ordering
item.description: Definition A [[Partial Ordering]] $(T, \leq)$ is a [[Total Ordering]] if $\forall x,y \in T$, either $x \leq y$ or $y \leq x$.

item.title: Total Orderings that cannot be Order Embedded into the Reals
item.description: Example 1 See Elementary Example that uses $\mathbb{R}^{2}$ and a [[Lexicographic Ordering]]. Example 2 [[Total Ordering]] on [[Hyperreal Numbers]] Other Outlinks [[Real Numbers]] [[Order Embedding]]

item.title: Total Subset
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. We say $A \subset X$ is a [[Total Subset]] if $\text{cl}(\text{span}A) = X$.

item.title: Totally Disconnected
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Topological Space]]. It is [[Totally Disconnected]] if all its [[Connected Component]]s are singleton [[Set]]s.

item.title: Trajectory
item.description: Definition Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{A}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]], let $(T, \leq)$ be a [[Total Ordering]], and let $(S, \Sigma)$ be a [[Measure Space]].

item.title: Tree
item.description: Definition Suppose $G$ is an [[Undirected Graph]]. Then $G$ is a [[Tree]] if $G$ is a [[Connected Graph]] and for each $u, v \in V(G)$, there exists only one [[Simple Path]] from $u$ to $v$.

item.title: Tree Distance
item.description: Definition Suppose $T$ is a [[Tree]]. Then the [[Tree Distance]] between $u, v \in V$ is the [[Path Length]] of the (unique) [[Simple Path]] from $u$ to $v$.

item.title: Tuple
item.description: Definition 1 A [[Tuple]] of length $2$ is an [[Ordered Pair]]. A [[Tuple]] of length $n > 2$ consisting of $(x_{1}, x_{2}, …, x_{n})$ is the [[Ordered Pair]] $(x_{1}, (x_{2}, \dots, x_{n}))$, where $(x_{2}, \dots, x_n)$ is a [[Tuple]] of length $n-1$.

item.title: TurboAE
item.description: [[TurboAE]] is a [[Deep Learning]] [[Machine Learning Model]] implemented and published by [[Yihan Jiang]]. The model attempts to solve the [[Channel Coding]] problem by searching for a [[Neural Network]] [[Coding Encoder]] and [[Coding Decoder]] that mimic the architecture of a [[Turbo Code]].

item.title: Tutte's Matching Theorem
item.description: Statment Let $G = (V, E)$ be an [[Undirected Graph]]. For any $B \subset V$, let $\text{oc}(G[B])$ be the number of [[Graph Connected Component]]s of $G[B]$ with [[Odd Integer|odd]] number of [[Graph Vertex|vertices]].

item.title: Tutte-Berge Formula
item.description: Statement Let $G = (V, E)$ be an [[Undirected Graph]]. For any $B \subset V$, let $\text{oc}(G[B])$ be the number of [[Graph Connected Component]]s of $G[B]$ with [[Odd Integer|odd]] number of [[Graph Vertex|vertices]].

item.title: Unary
item.description: Definition A [[Function]] is [[Unary]] if it has [[Arity]] 1.

item.title: Undirected Graph
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Set]] and suppose $E \subset {{v, w} \in \mathcal{P}(V) : v, w \in V, v \neq w}$.

item.title: Undirected Hypergraph
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Set]] and suppose $E \subset \mathcal{P}(V)$. Then $(V, E)$ is an [[Undirected Hypergraph]] with [[Graph Vertex|vertices]] $v \in V$ and [[Hypergraph Edge|edges]] $e \in E$.

item.title: Uniform Convergence
item.description: Definition Let $(M_{i}, d_{i}){i \in I}$ be [[Metric Space]]s with [[Index Set]] $I$ and let $M = \prod\limits{i \in I}^{} M_{i}$.

item.title: Uniform Integrability
item.description: Definition 1 Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] and let ${X_{t}}{t \in T}$ be a [[Set|collection]] of [[Random Variable]]s with [[Index Set]] $T$.

item.title: Unit Sphere
item.description: Definition Let $X$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. The [[Unit Sphere]] is the [[Sphere]] of radius $1$ about $0 \in X$.

item.title: Unit Vector
item.description: Definition Let $(X, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]]. We say $x \in X$ is a [[Unit Vector]] if $||x|| = 1$.

item.title: Univariate Monomials form Infinite Basis for Univariate Polynomials on Complex Numbers
item.description: Statement Let $P[\mathbb{C}]$ to be the [[Space of Polynomials over a Field form a Vector Subspace of Function Vector Space|polynomial vector space]] over $\mathbb{C}$.

item.title: Univariate Polynomials on Complex Numbers are Infinite-Dimensional
item.description: Statement Let $P[\mathbb{C}]$ be the [[Space of Polynomials over a Field form a Vector Subspace of Function Vector Space|space of polynomials]] over $\mathbb{C}$.

item.title: Univariate Polynomials on Real Numbers are Infinite-Dimensional
item.description: Statement Let $P[\mathbb{R}]$ be the [[Space of Polynomials over a Field form a Vector Subspace of Function Vector Space|space of polynomials]] over $\mathbb{R}$.

item.title: Upcrossing Inequality
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]]. Let $(X_{n}){n \geq 1}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Process|discrete-time]] [[Submartingale]] wrt [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{F}{n} \subset \mathcal{B}){n \in \mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Upcrossing Strategy
item.description: Statement Let $(\Omega, \mathcal{B}, \mathbb{P})$ be a [[Probability Space]] . Let $(X_{n}){n \geq 1}$ be a [[Discrete-Time Process|discrete-time]] [[Adapted Process]] wrt [[Discrete-Time Filtration]] $\mathcal{F}{*} := (\mathcal{F}{n} \subset \mathcal{B}){n \in \mathbb{N}}$.

item.title: Upcrossings
item.description: Definition 1 Suppose $(x_{n})_{n=0}^{\infty} \subset \mathbb{R}$ is a [[Sequence]] and $a < b \in \mathbb{R}$. [[Induction|Inductively]] define for $i \in \mathbb{N}$:

item.title: Upper Bound
item.description: Definition Let $(P, \leq)$ be a [[Partial Ordering]] and let $A \subset P$. $x \in P$ is an [[Upper Bound]] for $A$ if $\forall a \in A$, $p \geq a$.

item.title: Valid Formula
item.description: Definition Let $\mathcal{L}$ be a [[Language]]. $\phi$ is a [[Valid Formula|Valid]] $\mathcal{L}$-[[Formula]] if for each $\mathcal{L}$-[[Language Structure|structure]] $\mathcal{M}$ and each [[Assignment]] $\sigma$, we have that $\mathcal{M} \models_{\sigma} \phi$.

item.title: Vector Space
item.description: Definition Suppose $V$ is a [[Nonempty]] [[Set]], $F$ is a [[Field]], and $+: V \times V \to V$ and $*: F \times V \to V$ are [[Operation]]s.

item.title: Vector Space Basis
item.description: Definition Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $S \subset V$ is a [[Vector Space Basis|basis]] for $V$ if $\text{span} S = V$ $S$ is [[Linearly Independent]].

item.title: Vector Subspace
item.description: Definition Suppose $V$ is a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$. Supppose $W \subset V$ and $W$ is a [[Vector Space]] over $F$ when endowed with the same $+$ and $*$ operations as $V$.

item.title: Vector Subspace is a Normed Vector Subspace
item.description: Statement Let $(V, ||\cdot||)$ be a [[Normed Vector Space]] over $\mathbb{K} = \mathbb{R}$ or $\mathbb{C}$. If $W \subset V$ is a [[Vector Subspace]], then $(W, ||\cdot|| {\big|}_{W})$ is a [[Normed Vector Space]] called a [[Normed Vector Subspace]].

item.title: Vertex Cover
item.description: Definition Let $G$ be an [[Undirected Graph]]. A [[Vertex Cover]] $C \subset V(G)$ is a [[Set]] s.t. ${e \in E(G) : e \cap C \neq \emptyset} = E(G)$.

item.title: Vertex Cover and Matching Duality
item.description: Statement Suppose $G = (V, E)$ is an [[Undirected Graph]]. Then $\tau(G) \geq \nu(G)$. Proof [[TODO]] - This is a simple counting argument

item.title: Zermelo-Fraenkel Set Theory
item.description: [[Axiom of Extensionality]] [[Axiom of Regularity]] [[Axiom Schema of Specification]] [[Axiom of Pairing]] [[Axiom of Union]] [[Axiom Schema of Replacement]] [[Axiom of Infinity]] [[Axiom of Power Set]] *[[Axiom of Choice]] Remarks [[Axiom]]s (1)-(8) form [[ZF-Theory]].

item.title: Zero Subspace has Dimension 0
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]]. Then $\dim {\mathbf{0}} = 0$ for $\mathbf{0} \in V$. Proof Recall that [[The Empty Set is Linearly Independent]] and $$\text{span} \emptyset = \bigcap\limits{W \subset V : S \subset W, W \text{ is a subspace of V}} = {\mathbf{0}},$$since every [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$ is a superset of $\emptyset$ and ${\mathbf{0}}$ is a [[Vector Subspace]] of every [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$.

item.title: Zero Vector Subspace
item.description: Statement Let $V$ be a [[Vector Space]] over [[Field]] $F$. Then the [[Set]] ${\mathbf{0}}$ is a [[Vector Subspace]] of $V$. It is known as the [[Zero Vector Subspace]] of $V$.

item.title: ZF-Theory
item.description: Definition The [[Theory]] made up of the following [[Axiom]]s and [[Axiom Schema]]s: [[Axiom of Extensionality]] [[Axiom of Regularity]] [[Axiom Schema of Specification]] [[Axiom of Pairing]] [[Axiom of Union]] [[Axiom Schema of Replacement]] [[Axiom of Infinity]] [[Axiom of Power Set]]

item.title: ZFC-Theory
item.description: Definition The [[Theory]] made up of the [[Set Union]] of [[ZF-Theory]] with the [[Axiom of Choice]].
